One I've been looking into is improving our radio, to help get in touch with others.  Not long ago we received a brief burst of radio chatter that will lead us to a chance at killing two birds with one stone.  One of our contacts from before the apocalypse had evidently secured a radio transmitter and established contact, before something knocked out the signal.  I'd like you to investigate.

Thank you. They'd secured a radio stati.msgid: Thank you.  They'd secured a radio station in one of the old towns, I'd advise caution.  They confirmed the use of what they called a relay beacon to make use of the station's transmitter.  It not only contains what they used to get their signal across to us, but a tracker that whoever else they're working with can use to get in touch with us.  Return with that and we should be able to re-establish contact.

Please, speak with me if you change your.msgid: Please, speak with me if you change your mind.  We don't know who else they might be in contact with, nor whether they might move on before we can get in touch with them.

Be prepared for a fight. They mentioned.msgid: Be prepared for a fight.  They mentioned being followed by something, and that's going to be in addition to the usual abominations that infest the cities.

Thank you. This should provide the fini.msgid: Thank you.  This should provide the finishing touches.  I'll get to work immediately, I know the rest of them were already looking for us.  They should be here shortly, now that we have the means to extend our signal as well as a signal they can track.  That should be everything we need for now.

Retrieve the bane staff from the strange.msgid: Retrieve the bane staff from the strange grove, and bring it to Johnathan.

During our journey we've seen scattered.msgid: During our journey we've seen scattered evidence of some hazards still afflicting certain areas, former hotspots of anomalous activity now made even more dangerous, ever since holes in reality began opening up.  With the rest of us focused on rebuilding and securing the area, I would like to ask your assistance with investigating one such location, and retrieving an artifact of historical importance believed to be lost there.

Thank you. I will direct you to the loc.msgid: Thank you.  I will direct you to the location, if you've not seen it for yourself.  Decades ago the place was inhabited, but now the place seems to be overgrown and infested with monsters.  Do what you must to cleanse the place, and retrieve what the texts called a bane staff.  Dii vult.

When you believe you are ready, talk to.msgid: When you believe you are ready, talk to me again.  The longer these old places linger without being dealt with, the more of a threat they may become.

The extent to which the place has overgr.msgid: The extent to which the place has overgrown is unnatural.  I would expect monsters comfortable among greenery to be the most common threat, and we have reason to believe something large has taken root there.  Beyond that, I can tell you little of the history behind that place, Sofia might know more.

Thank you. That staff was associated wi.msgid: Thank you.  That staff was associated with those who once inhabited that place, but it seems whatever anomalies caused all this corrupted it to some extent.  I will care for it, anything else you found down there you may deal with as you see fit.  The rest of us will try to discern just what to make of these anomalies.

Retrieve the demon claw from the curious.msgid: Retrieve the demon claw from the curious structure, and bring it to Johnathan.

I believe I can now trust you with a mor.msgid: I believe I can now trust you with a more dangerous, yet also more vital, task.  In the past we had few dedicated safehouses, most of us were hosted in the rural homes and churches of our brethren and those they could trust.  Only one place was truly built by our hand, and it suffered the same strange occurrences so many other places suffered during zero hour.  The handful of survivors to flee brought with them tales of living fire and otherworldly horror, warping the very stones underneath the sanctum.  If you believe yourself ready, I would like you to lead a hunt to cleanse it, and take the demon's claws as proof of the hunt.

By Thor and The God In Three Persons bot.msgid: By Thor and The God In Three Persons both, may you be victorious.  The evil lurking there was described as wielding a clawed weapon that warped The Veil itself with hellfire, until it was struck from its fiery grasp by a lucky strike.  They were able to seal it behind a barrier with one of our swords as the keystone, and you will need to undo the seal to confront it.  If you can retrieve that infernal weapon in your hunt, we will be able to destroy it safely.  I would commit a full hunting party if only we could spare anyone.  Dii vult!

Understood. This task is dangerous, and.msgid: Understood.  This task is dangerous, and the seal they set up shouldn't be undone unless you're prepared to see it through to the end.  Speak with me when you see fit.

Bring any assistance you can, and expect.msgid: Bring any assistance you can, and expect all manner of abominations to have followed that thing through the wounds in The Veil.  Be prepared for infernal fire, any magic or equipment that would safeguard against flame would help.  Do as best as you can to assemble a proper hunting party, but sadly we are stretched thin as it is.

Gods above and below, to think this thin.msgid: Gods above and below, to think this thing caused one of our holiest places to fall to ruin.  I doubt it will be safe to reclaim that place anytime soon.  Anything you found down there is yours to use as you see fit.  I hope that those who fell holding that thing back are at peace.  Speak with me when you see fit.

Kill the blood mage in charge of a local.msgid: Kill the blood mage in charge of a local Sanguine Order sect.  Optionally recruit one of the church's guards to assist.

We have evidence not only of a still-pra.msgid: We have evidence not only of a still-practicing group of sanguinists, but confirmation of their most likely hideout.  You know what must be done.  Their sect will be centralized around a local magus, prioritizing them will reduce the threat even if their underlings escape justice.  Hunt them down, when you are prepared for the task.

God and gods willing, may you return saf.msgid: God and gods willing, may you return safe and victorious.  This will be a dangerous task, and while we may be stretched thin, I will allow you to request assistance at your discretion.  We can spare another hunter for a task this dangerous.

I understand. Come back when you are pr.msgid: I understand.  Come back when you are prepared.

They will have pursued any advantage the.msgid: They will have pursued any advantage they could get their hands on.  Any weapon at their disposal, any foul magic, any corruption of body and soul.  Bring as many allies as you can muster to your cause, any weapon to suit you.

Thank the gods that you've returned safe.msgid: Thank the gods that you've returned safely!  May this serve as a warning to any who would further endanger humanity.  I hope that you will use proper discretion in dealing with any dangerous items you retrieved from that place.  While you were gone, one of our scouting missions made contact with a small holdout of our brethren, which should ease some of the workload here.

Search the last known encampment of a gr.msgid: Search the last known encampment of a group of survivors, who have recently encountered anomalous activity.  Bring back any unusual items found there, that may prove useful to identifying and locating the origin of this threat.

Seeing this is probably a bug, as this m.msgid: Seeing this is probably a bug, as this mission is actually started via add_mission in dialogue.

Seeing this is probably a bug..msgid: Seeing this is probably a bug.

Alright, let me see. This might help, b.msgid: Alright, let me see.  This might help, but I don't think I can do much with this just yet.  Keep that for now and bring it to Sofia, see if she can figure anything else out.  I'll do what I can to review the other intel I have regarding the attacks.  Narrowing down the area plus getting a better feel for what we're up against should let us pinpoint the cause.

Seek out an anomalous structure that has.msgid: Seek out an anomalous structure that has recently forced its way into our world.  Kill whatever abomination lies at its heart.

The time has come. We have discussed th.msgid: The time has come.  We have discussed the nature of this anomaly, confirmed the source.  There is something there, subtle but becoming more detectable by the day.  Whatever disruption lies within, it must be cleansed.  I trust you with this task, if you accept it.

God and gods willing, return safe and so.msgid: God and gods willing, return safe and sound.  I will once more authorize you to request the aid of one of our hunters if you require it.  Furthermore, if you did not already seek their aid last time, you may still do so.  We can afford that much at least, for a mission this important.

We're stretched thin as it is, please re.msgid: We're stretched thin as it is, please return as soon as you're able to accept this task.  I worry that things will only worsen if this threat is left unchecked.

Reports suggest it is a warped, ruined r.msgid: Reports suggest it is a warped, ruined remnant of some unholy alien structure, similar to what those chitinous abominations build.  I have no doubt that there are greater anomalies and hazards within.  Exercise extreme caution, bring any firepower as well as physical and magical protection that you can obtain.

Good. Seeing you walk in here alive, I.msgid: Good.  Seeing you walk in here alive, I could almost sense that the deed was done.  I do not know the cause of this, nor what the future holds.  Only that we have bought ourselves much-needed time, to pursue any research that might prevent further catastrophes in the future.  There are no further tasks I can offer you, nor any greater reward I can spare.  We, perhaps all of humanity in the long term, are in your debt.

Find or make 5 blank scrolls for the sca.msgid: Find or make 5 blank scrolls for the scavengers operating out of the rural church.

Some of the scavenger team has taken an.msgid: Some of the scavenger team has taken an interest in the sort of strange stuff the locals here deal with.  I talked it out with Ms. McKinnon and she said she can help with teaching, and we've decided to focus on scrolls.  They provide us with a relatively reusable way to deal with trouble while on a scouting run.  If you can get about five blanks for us, we'll be able to figure things out from there.

Thanks. They seem to know their stuff w.msgid: Thanks.  They seem to know their stuff well enough to assist in teaching us the basics, so once we have some blank scrolls we'll be able to make a couple of the safer ones for our scouts to use.

Alright. Come see me if you change your.msgid: Alright.  Come see me if you change your mind.

They mentioned that the book that teache.msgid: They mentioned that the book that teaches you how to use these items is called The Six Pillars.  If you can't find any suitable scrolls out there, that book might be useful for getting the specifications needed to make one.

Thank you, and here's enough of these Sc.msgid: Thank you, and here's enough of these Scales to hopefully make up for the hassle.  Least I can do.  According to Sofia, they turn blank after you activate the effects put into them.  So we'll be able to make these last a while, as long as the scavengers aren't too rough on the paper.

Find or make a wraithslayer crossbow for.msgid: Find or make a wraithslayer crossbow for the scavengers operating out of the rural church.

Welp, some of the boys here have been ge.msgid: Welp, some of the boys here have been getting interested in the mystical stuff these fellas are preaching, but personally I'm most interested in one of them magic stringless crossbows they take a liking to.  Ammo for it's real portable, they seem to have plenty of it, and it goes through tough hide like nothing I've ever seen before.  I don't know if they have one to spare, but if you can get your hands on one, I'll pay up as well as I can for it.

Alright then. I don't think they'd look.msgid: Alright then.  I don't think they'd look too kindly on us diving right into carrying these things around, but I'll talk it out with them later on.  Just don't want to bother them too much about it, you know?

Hell, you change your mind just come see.msgid: Hell, you change your mind just come see me, y'hear?

Figure they have some way to make those.msgid: Figure they have some way to make those things, if you can't get your hands on one…

Damn this thing looks fancy, I hope this.msgid: Damn this thing looks fancy, I hope this is enough for your trouble.  Actually hell, the boys and I just took in a decent haul not long ago, I can do one better than just paying you.  I'll have a cut of the last hunt laid out on the table in the main room laid out for you.

Bring a copy of History of Alchemy.msgid: Bring a copy of History of Alchemy

Find a copy of History of Alchemy for th.msgid: Find a copy of History of Alchemy for the Old Guard doctor stationed at the rural church.

I need you to do something discreet for.msgid: I need you to do something discreet for me, if you could.  The locals here are still a bit reluctant to work with us, and I can understand why.  Personally, I just want to go about my duties here as best as I'm able, and I think the best way to keep my superiors from causing trouble would be if I provided them with information that'd give them good reason to work with this place, instead of working against them.  I have something in mind that'd kill two birds with one stone, as it were.  If you can provide me with a copy of their medical text, History of Alchemy, I'll be able to better treat people here, and it'll give me a bargaining chip to keep things civil between the locals and my superiors.

Excellent. I know this is a bit of an o.msgid: Excellent.  I know this is a bit of an odd task, but it will do a lot to ease my mind.  Not to mention, as anomalous as all this is, having the opportunity to better understand what I've gotten myself into would be appreciated.

Please reconsider, I'll do what I can to.msgid: Please reconsider, I'll do what I can to repay you if you're able to handle this for me.

You can see if they have a book to spare.msgid: You can see if they have a book to spare, but do try not to be overly obvious about it…

Thank you. I've already been in contact.msgid: Thank you.  I've already been in contact with my CO and they're interested in getting more intel as well.  I'm still a little concerned, but I feel a bit more confident that they aren't going to do anything rash.  As promised, fair payment and a little something extra.  This is an RX-12 stimulant delivery module.  You might find it useful for emergencies.  Came in with the latest gear shipment.

Obtain a red flower associated with othe.msgid: Obtain a red flower associated with otherworldly plant monsters, and return it to the farmhand.

Not long after I got here I took an inte.msgid: Not long after I got here I took an interest in the sorts of things the locals collected.  Truth is, early on when shit hit the fan I picked up a few books and some other experience with all this strangeness.  Not much, but enough to keep me another day away from dying.  I used to help tend to crops, these new experiences and some of the weird creatures I've seen gave me an idea for something that might improve crop yields.  Interested?

Alright. Truth is, it's a bit dangerous.msgid: Alright.  Truth is, it's a bit dangerous hunting those monsters out there.  The big walking plants, making nests burrowed underground.  When I went to Ms. McKinnon with the idea she said she'd keep an eye out for any leads.  I'll give you directions to a local hotspot she got wind of from her scouts.  If you visit it, keep an eye out for the ones with bright red flowers, that can raise hell growing plants like wildfire.  I need the flower itself.

Well alright, come back anytime if you c.msgid: Well alright, come back anytime if you change your mind.  I doubt it'll be a massive improvement to the logistics of things here or at the commune, but it's worth looking into.

Most of those things are venomous and ri.msgid: Most of those things are venomous and right nasty to get tangled up in.  Just be mindful about burning them out, I don't want to risk harming what you're there for.

Alright. Sofia's skeptical that I can m.msgid: Alright.  Sofia's skeptical that I can make a large-scale breakthrough with this.  I can use what I've learned, and a little help from her, to liven up the compound here and grow a few things, but it seems it'll take a lot of energy plus burn out whatever force is still present in these petals.  They have a way to weave its effects into someone's very being so they don't need to hunt monsters, but that just makes it drain energy out of whoever uses it instead.  Still, thank you for the help, should have the finishing touches ready right quick.

Put down the cause of a recent attack on.msgid: Put down the cause of a recent attack on a caravan, then report back to the shopkeep.

I've been working on getting some equipm.msgid: I've been working on getting some equipment set up here, to expand the kinds of things we can make.  I have a guy bringing in supplies and we can get it set up ourselves.  Problem is, I had to get in touch with a new transport team because the last one up and vanished.  Word from the other scavengers gave me an estimate of what happened, and it doesn't sound good.  I'd like you to go scope it out, and put down whoever or whatever caused this.

Thanks. You can keep anything from the.msgid: Thanks.  You can keep anything from the caravan you can salvage, I'm more interested in taking care of whatever ambushed them.

Alright. I want you to come see me if y.msgid: Alright.  I want you to come see me if you change your mind, though.

I don't know what to expect out there, i.msgid: I don't know what to expect out there, intel suggests some kinda rock formation that wasn't on the local route maps, might be a hideout, staging area, lair or who knows what.  Could be some kinda anomaly.

Good. Those people I worked with were f.msgid: Good.  Those people I worked with were friends of mine.  From what little I understand of what happened out there and what you saw out there, seems like a dogshit way to go out.  Lil payback at least keeps those things from threatening other scavs.  Anyway, things should be just about set up by now.

Find a laptop briefcase at the last know.msgid: Find a laptop briefcase at the last known location of a Cleaning Flame scout, and bring it back for Nicholas to examine for useful information.

When we were on our way here, we had bee.msgid: When we were on our way here, we had been trying to regain contact with another member of our order.  She had been on a scouting mission, gathering information we suspect will lead us to a breakthrough regarding the cause of this apocalypse, or failing that a way to prevent things from getting worse.  I'd like to ask you to help track her down, or recover the device they stored their intel on if it's too late for them.

Last we heard, she was headed to an old.msgid: Last we heard, she was headed to an old rest stop to search for supplies, and said she'd contact us afterward.  I'll show you the location they reported here.  If you don't find any sign of her, look for what we called a reconnaissance case.  It's a briefcase with a laptop, plus some other observation and communication items in it.  I'm going to hope and pray the data is still salvageable.

If this lead goes anywhere, it might be.msgid: If this lead goes anywhere, it might be our last hope of reversing at least some of the damage the fabric of reality has suffered.  I'm not that optimistic of it working out either, but it's worth trying.  Please come back and talk to me if you change your mind.

If she had a communication failure she'l.msgid: If she had a communication failure she'll have likely hidden the laptop there as a dead drop, since we'd know that to be her last destination.  Unless something happened to her, that's what worries me.  It shouldn't be too close to the cities but there's always the risk that something dangerous might be in the area, so be on your guard.

Did you find her? What about the intel?.msgid: Did you find her?  What about the intel?

Gods above and below, I'm glad you're ba.msgid: Gods above and below, I'm glad you're back in one piece.  I'm guessing she didn't make it.  From the look of this, the laptop almost didn't either.  But it looks like I can get intel out of it, so her death won't be in vain.  Come see me when you've rested up a bit, whenever you feel you're ready.

Investigate for further information abou.msgid: Investigate for further information about Project Kairos, talking to others familiar with military or science facilities.  Bring any findings back to Nicholas.

I'd like for you to find anyone else you.msgid: I'd like for you to find anyone else you think might be familiar with the military's experiments, the research labs, that sort of thing.  People who might be able to help us get a definite location out of what little information we have to go on.  If they give us any leads, I'd like you to bring whatever intel you find back here.

Here's a printout of all the useful info.msgid: Here's a printout of all the useful information I got out of the laptop concerning Project Kairos.  It contains a list of known Priority Sites and records of shipments between them.  Show this to someone who might know more about what these specific Priority Sites were up to, and ideally which of those shipments contained anomalous materials.  We might get a namedrop of the project, or just confirmation that one location in particular was getting the bulk of the anomalous items.

Come back if you change your mind. You.msgid: Come back if you change your mind.  You need to understand how close we are to a breakthrough.  All that information Sofia gathered, if we had this project's findings to go with that, we might be able to fix some of this.

Some of the people at the refugee center.msgid: Some of the people at the refugee center might have contacts with the Old Guard.  I don't know if they'll be that willing to help us or not, but if they understand the direness of the situation they might be our best bet.  Otherwise, if you know of any surviving research personnel from other government labs, they might be worth talking to.

This should give us a better understandi.msgid: This should give us a better understanding of which places were actually receiving anomalous materials.  Let's go over this together, then we should be ready.

Investigate a science lab and retrieve t.msgid: Investigate a science lab and retrieve the intel Nicholas is looking for from their server room.  After bringing the shipping manifest back to Nicholas, you may return to the refugee center later to check on the Old Guard's doctor.

Did you find what you're looking for?.msgid: Did you find what you're looking for?

That's good. I've been going over the i.msgid: That's good.  I've been going over the information your contact sent us, maybe some day we'll have the manpower to investigate some of these places.  I'll leave the matter of this "Project Kairos" to your contact to deal with, I trust they can handle whatever it is they're looking for safely.  Here's something for your trouble, the least I can do after you helped arrange this.

Investigate the last known location of a.msgid: Investigate the last known location of a group of survivors, suspected to have found documents of the information Nicholas is looking for.  After bringing the information back to Nicholas, you may return to bring back news of what happened to the scavengers.

I'm guessing it was too late for them..msgid: I'm guessing it was too late for them.  I did hear from Sofia's people however, we now have a much better understanding of what places might be valuable sources of supplies, and which are best avoided.  This will save lives in the long run.  I know it's not much given the risk you went through, but here.

Investigate the location known to be use.msgid: Investigate the location known to be used for organizing the transportation of items from local science labs, which may have the documents Nicholas is looking for.  Additionally, bring a t-substrate sample back to Hub 01.

Retrieve dimensional focus lens from Pro.msgid: Retrieve dimensional focus lens from Project Kairos facility

Investigate the research facility now su.msgid: Investigate the research facility now suspected to be the location of Project Kairos, and retrieve a vital component known as a dimensional focus lens from it.

A large volume, the bulk of anomalous it.msgid: A large volume, the bulk of anomalous items on these shipping records, eventually found their way to a single site.  That's what we're after, and I've also figured out exactly what we need.  One of the earlier shipments on record mentions something called a dimensional focus lens.  Given what we know of the project and what they were trying to accomplish, that's the component we need to acquire to use their findings to further our own work.  Will you help us?

Thank you. I'll give you directions to.msgid: Thank you.  I'll give you directions to your objective.  Whatever device the component was used for, it'll likely be well-secured, unless there's been a containment breach or some other disaster.  Take apart any anomalous machinery you find down there, we don't know if it will have been used for a portable device, or a machine that'll have to be scrapped to recover the component.

Please return to me if you change your m.msgid: Please return to me if you change your mind.  We are on the edge of a breakthrough, and this might give us the means to massively improve our changes of survival.

There's no way they haven't been overrun.msgid: There's no way they haven't been overrun by now.  If you've ever explored those old facilities you'll know there's a high risk of the place crawling with undead.  Who knows what other anomalies may be there, too?  Be on your guard.

It's just as I thought. The culmination.msgid: It's just as I thought.  The culmination of several different research facilities, a project to bring these pieces together, and a very faint aura to it.  They did a lot of testing with the machinery they built, didn't they?  That helps us too.  This a lot for me to take in and analyze, give me about three days and I should have some results you might be interested in taking a look at.  In the meantime, if you have any questions I'll see what I can answer.

I've been sent to ask about recent attac.msgid: I've been sent to ask about recent attacks on survivors by anomalous creatures.  Know anything about that?

A while back I ran into something like t.msgid: A while back I ran into something like that myself, actually.  Was in the evening, a few strange creatures showed up while I was starting a controlled burn of an abandoned block.  Came out of the shadows and it seemed like the shadows followed them.  I cut down the street and it seems the firelight either scared them off or distracted them.

There are people surviving out there, at.msgid: There are people surviving out there, at least.  Still work to be done.

It's a group operating out of a rural ch.msgid: It's a group operating out of a rural church along the roadside, I was asked to see if I could find another trading partner for them.

There's a decent-sized holdout I was ask.msgid: There's a decent-sized holdout I was asked to help find another trading partner for.

I've heard a little bit about a place li.msgid: I've heard a little bit about a place like before, from a couple other local scavengers.  Never visited them myself, a bit out of the way from where I prefer to scout out, plus I'd rather not set fires where they might cause trouble for other holdouts.  I could try telling the other scavs about there being work there, I guess.

I'd appreciate the help if you could, su.msgid: I'd appreciate the help if you could, sure.

It's fine, I was going to look into othe.msgid: It's fine, I was going to look into other options just in case.

Might as well while I'm here, might get.msgid: Might as well while I'm here, might get a few looters tied up in steady work instead of poking around in buildings I'm trying to work on.

Thanks! I've talked to a few others as.msgid: Thanks!  I've talked to a few others as well, that should be enough to get word out.  I should go check up on them.

Thanks! I might talk to someone else to.msgid: Thanks!  I might talk to someone else to help get word out.

Thanks! I'll see if talking to a couple.msgid: Thanks!  I'll see if talking to a couple other people will help.

Huh, might be interesting. What can you.msgid: Huh, might be interesting.  What can you tell me about them?

They're operating out of a rural parish.msgid: They're operating out of a rural parish church, and have been expanding to make their settlement more self-sufficient.

What the hell? What are you doing here?.msgid: What the hell?  What are you doing here?

\"The moonlit sky anoints the worthy, wh.msgid: "The moonlit sky anoints the worthy, who seek The Path home."

What can you tell me about this place?.msgid: What can you tell me about this place?

You are not alone in following The Path..msgid: You are not alone in following The Path.

A former enemy taught me this secret. W.msgid: A former enemy taught me this secret.  We need not be enemies either.

There are many followers of The Path who.msgid: There are many followers of The Path who still live.

We are not enemies. Some of your own ha.msgid: We are not enemies.  Some of your own have joined us.

What, you expect us to just give up and.msgid: What, you expect us to just give up and join you, hunter?  When The Path has prepared us to survive in this ruined world, why would one of the shrikes defect to your cause?

And why would a hunter complete the Drag.msgid: And why would a hunter complete the Dragonblood Sacrament?  We must all do what is necessary for humanity to survive.

They have seen that the error is not in.msgid: They have seen that the error is not in The Path, but in using it for self-destructive reasons.

[ATTACK] I expect nothing but a quick de.msgid: [ATTACK] I expect nothing but a quick death from you, sanguinist.

As the shrikes have always done, seeking.msgid: As the shrikes have always done, seeking to defend our order.  But to join you?  I don't know what to think.  None of this has felt right, ever since the world ended.

They entrusted us with knowledge collect.msgid: They entrusted us with knowledge collected by the other shrikes.  Come with me, and use what you've learned to make things right.

These people are beyond saving. Find yo.msgid: These people are beyond saving.  Find your own path, but leave this place.  Flee, and do not return.

Bullshit. You interrogated one of them.msgid: Bullshit.  You interrogated one of them to get that old code phrase, didn't you?  Probably killed them afterwards too.  Die, hunter!

So one of the shrikes sent you? Have th.msgid: So one of the shrikes sent you?  Have they strayed from The Path?  What is the meaning of this?

Why not ask yourself why I'm standing he.msgid: Why not ask yourself why I'm standing here, having completed what your master is still trying to recreate?

They've saved valuable knowledge from de.msgid: They've saved valuable knowledge from destruction, and have made amends with the Cleaning Flame.  We don't have to fight either.

You're speaking of madness. The Sanguin.msgid: You're speaking of madness.  The Sanguine Order, and the Cleansing Flame, working together?  What common ground could we have, when their very existence is our anathema?

They're found a way to work together. Y.msgid: They're found a way to work together.  You could too, make something better out of all this.

Alright. I believe you, it feels like w.msgid: Alright.  I believe you, it feels like we've been aimless ever since the apocalypse started.  But what could I even do?

They sent me, come with me. We can help.msgid: They sent me, come with me.  We can help you put what you've learned to good use.

Leave this place, find your own path, an.msgid: Leave this place, find your own path, and don't look back.  Run.

You must be either lost or crazy. This.msgid: You must be either lost or crazy.  This place isn't safe, and you're not welcome here.  Leave, and forget this place even exists.

I am a servant of He From Beyond The Vei.msgid: I am a servant of He From Beyond The Veil.  We are not enemies.

You would not welcome a student of the a.msgid: You would not welcome a student of the arcane?

I can see you dabble in what I have alre.msgid: I can see you dabble in what I have already achieved.

Whatever old truce my masters had with y.msgid: Whatever old truce my masters had with yours, it died with the end of the world.  I'll let you go just this once.  Leave, and don't come back.  If the others found out I'm doing this, they'd kill me.

His will is greater than those you serve.msgid: His will is greater than those you serve.  Stand aside.

Actually, my masters might find you usef.msgid: Actually, my masters might find you useful, as a sacrifice if nothing else.  Die!

So you found what we seek? My masters w.msgid: So you found what we seek?  My masters would be pleased to make use of your work, and your blood might make a useful sacrifice.

If you turn me over to your master, what.msgid: If you turn me over to your master, what promise do you have that they'll share what they learn with you?

Consider your words more carefully. You.msgid: Consider your words more carefully.  You really think you can take me?

I, well. We've already benefited a bit.msgid: I, well.  We've already benefited a bit from our own research.  Even if the master has practically bled us dry for every fragment of knowledge we earn.  This hasn't felt right anymore, ever since it all ended.  But what the hell am I supposed to do?  What are you even suggesting I do?

Let them squabble and stab each other in.msgid: Let them squabble and stab each other in the back, until they destroy themselves over scraps of arcane knowledge.  Join me and live.

They will simply kill you when you cease.msgid: They will simply kill you when you cease to be useful to them.  I'll at least let you escape with your life.  Go on, whelp.  Flee.

[ATTACK] You're pathetic. You don't des.msgid: [ATTACK] You're pathetic.  You don't deserve to live.

Maybe that's true. But our unity under.msgid: Maybe that's true.  But our unity under The Path has been broken.  It's survival of the strongest now, isn't it?  The magus here won't welcome another into the fold, you'll only be seen as a rival.

[ATTACK] Then let the strong rule. Die..msgid: [ATTACK] Then let the strong rule.  Die.

And your master wants to recreate it? W.msgid: And your master wants to recreate it?  We don't have to fight.

There are many ways to pursue The Path..msgid: There are many ways to pursue The Path.  It doesn't have to end in us coming to blows.

[ATTACK] This must end, no matter our hi.msgid: [ATTACK] This must end, no matter our history.  Stand and fight.

Indeed, I wish the magus would permit us.msgid: Indeed, I wish the magus would permit us to work together instead.  My master would greatly value what you've learned.  But you'd be considered a threat.

Can you trust that your master will shar.msgid: Can you trust that your master will share the fruit of these studies with you?

[ATTACK] I'll show you and the others ju.msgid: [ATTACK] I'll show you and the others just how much of a threat I am.

I have succeeded where others have faile.msgid: I have succeeded where others have failed, pursuing the same method that your master seeks.  Can you really trust your master?.

Your master has erred in judgment. They.msgid: Your master has erred in judgment.  They are not worthy of being followed.

[ATTACK] Then die, defending your misgui.msgid: [ATTACK] Then die, defending your misguided fool of a master.

You're right. This isn't the right way.msgid: You're right.  This isn't the right way to follow The Path.  Would you take me in as an apprentice?

[ATTACK] No. You will face the same jud.msgid: [ATTACK] No.  You will face the same judgment as your master.

And you think you're any more fit to rul.msgid: And you think you're any more fit to rule in this dying world?  "Even those of great power, if laid low, may serve to better the victor."  Die!

What? Oh shit… no, not you! Leave us.msgid: What?  Oh shit…  no, not you!  Leave us alone, hunter!

[ATTACK] Subire mortem tuam, sub malleo.msgid: [ATTACK] Subire mortem tuam, sub malleo deorum!

You don't just barge in here and expect.msgid: You don't just barge in here and expect to walk out without explaining yourself.  Why should I let you leave?

I am a servant of He From Beyond The Vei.msgid: I am a servant of He From Beyond The Veil.  There is no need for quarrel.

I am just a student of the arcane, seeki.msgid: I am just a student of the arcane, seeking further knowledge.  I'll leave peacefully, honest.

Look at me. I'm like you, there's no ne.msgid: Look at me.  I'm like you, there's no need for us to fight.

I didn't mean to intrude. Sorry. I'll.msgid: I didn't mean to intrude.  Sorry.  I'll just be going.

[ATTACK] Fuck you, I do what I want..msgid: [ATTACK] Fuck you, I do what I want.

Forget you ever saw anything here. Befo.msgid: Forget you ever saw anything here.  Before I change my mind.

Really? How pathetic. Your very presen.msgid: Really?  How pathetic.  Your very presence endangers what we're working on.  I can't let you leave alive.

It started in the cities, that much is c.msgid: It started in the cities, that much is clear.  That's why probably caught so many students of the Beyond off-guard.  Something in the water evidently, and my rough guess is that caused the rioting and undead at minimum.  No guesses beyond that, though.  I only knew a bit of the news due to having been fairly new to the Order.

What does the Sanguine Order have to do.msgid: What does the Sanguine Order have to do with it?

The magi liked to isolate us from civili.msgid: The magi liked to isolate us from civilization at large.  Typical cult stuff now that I think about it, plus made it easier to cover our tracks.  But, for all the talk of preparation and adaptation, I don't know if they really predicted this, but our isolation kept us from suffering the same fate as those in the cities.  Now it's just a matter of surviving, I guess.

I hadn't been in the Order for very long.msgid: I hadn't been in the Order for very long when one of the magi had everyone gathered up.  We were in this other place at the time with a couple others, and initially I thought she was preparing another lesson.

There were a few, yeah. The higher-rank.msgid: There were a few, yeah.  The higher-rank blood mages, basically.  This was before the one at the hideout split off from the others, and led us into trying to scrounge up some old research.  Things were tense back then, but at least I felt like I could trust those higher up in rank to reward fair study…

There was a shrike there, those were rat.msgid: There was a shrike there, those were rather rare by the time I joined.  That's what they call the guys that specialize in killing mage hunters.  They'd passed a message of some sort to the lead magus, whatever it was got her all agitated.  Started ranting and raving about the end of the world and the dead coming back to life.  They'd talk about stuff like that before, but it seemed different this time.

At first it was just the same shit, only.msgid: At first it was just the same shit, only thing that seemed strange was talking about it like it had already happened.  Before they'd be all vague, talking about portents and omens of doom, but it wasn't until we moved on to the next hideout that most of us at the bottom of the totem pole figured out something went down…

You shouldn't be here, meddling in thing.msgid: You shouldn't be here, meddling in things beyond your understanding.  Might get yourself hurt.

[MISSION] I'm here to put a stop to this.msgid: [MISSION] I'm here to put a stop to this.

Why do you follow this magus? We should.msgid: Why do you follow this magus?  We should be standing together.

Well that's the last thing I expected on.msgid: Well that's the last thing I expected one of you hunters to say.  So, who bled out to give you that pass phrase?

Alright, you've got my attention. You h.msgid: Alright, you've got my attention.  You had to hear that from somebody, who sent you?

The other shrikes have entrusted us with.msgid: The other shrikes have entrusted us with important information.  We need not be enemies, lanius.

One of Elena's shrikes said to tell you.msgid: One of Elena's shrikes said to tell you that.

Is it not according to your nature, to u.msgid: Is it not according to your nature, to use what you have learned to protect others?  The people here are on a path of self-destruction, we could be working together to protect all of humanity.

The one you follow is on a path only to.msgid: The one you follow is on a path only to failure.  If there are those who could be set right, then it is worth it to try.

[ATTACK] Forget it. Just shut up and di.msgid: [ATTACK] Forget it.  Just shut up and die.

[ATTACK] I have a better idea. Die..msgid: [ATTACK] I have a better idea.  Die.

We all deserve a second chance. We have.msgid: We all deserve a second chance.  We have an opportunity to set things right, to do what's best for humanity as a whole, not just ourselves.

It's not right. If we're tearing each o.msgid: It's not right.  If we're tearing each other to pieces while the world is like this, we're all fucked.  We could be working together.

[ATTACK] On second thought, I'd rather r.msgid: [ATTACK] On second thought, I'd rather rearrange your face.

Oh, how little you know of the things yo.msgid: Oh, how little you know of the things you've stumbled into.  All this talk of doing the right thing, when I can smell the blood on you.  At least we aren't deceiving ourselves about the nature of survival.  Enough talk.

And I'm here to put a stop to you puttin.msgid: And I'm here to put a stop to you putting a stop to this.  Funny how that works out.

Someone has to keep these idiots from ki.msgid: Someone has to keep these idiots from killing each other.  Not like you're helping with that.

They're misguided. This will only bring.msgid: They're misguided.  This will only bring what's left of our order into extinction.

[ATTACK] They aren't getting themselves.msgid: [ATTACK] They aren't getting themselves killed fast enough for my liking.

I think I see the problem. Let me guess.msgid: I think I see the problem.  Let me guess, quit the Order, found religion, and now the Keepers' little friend is pulling your strings?  "No god, no demon, no spirit can be trusted with power over you."  You've compromised your principles, friend.

I have my duties. They may be idiots bu.msgid: I have my duties.  They may be idiots but they're my idiots.  If you were interested in not dragging the order to extinction, then you should've left well enough alone while you had the chance.

This isn't about that. We can't continu.msgid: This isn't about that.  We can't continue down the path we're following, or they'll be nothing left for us.

I am not ruled by Him. I have made my c.msgid: I am not ruled by Him.  I have made my choice.  We must adapt, and in this case it requires an end to the old ways.

We can't keep backstabbing everyone we m.msgid: We can't keep backstabbing everyone we meet, we must be measured in our practice.

Join me. There will be others, and we c.msgid: Join me.  There will be others, and we can set them on the right track.

Really have lost sight of things, haven'.msgid: Really have lost sight of things, haven't you?  Let me see if I can get the point across for you.  Fuck you, and fuck your so-called god.  How's that?

I'm plenty measured in my practice, and.msgid: I'm plenty measured in my practice, and I think you'd look better with a bit of said backstabbing.

A hunter of hunters. As you've surely s.msgid: A hunter of hunters.  As you've surely seen, the others can't quite keep themselves from falling to pieces, often literally.

Today's your lucky day, I'm not the one.msgid: Today's your lucky day, I'm not the one who'll have to clean up the mess.  Go on.  Run.

[ATTACK] On second thought, how about I.msgid: [ATTACK] On second thought, how about I rearrange your face?

Go ahead and try, interloper. You'll on.msgid: Go ahead and try, interloper.  You'll only die tired.  Let the hunt begin.

I can tell you this much: you shouldn't.msgid: I can tell you this much: you shouldn't be down here.  Any more questions?

It wasn't anything supernatural, of that.msgid: It wasn't anything supernatural, of that much we're certain.  The Order had its suspicions that trouble was brewing, and we've been preparing for decades.  All the better to adapt and survive.  Still caught us a bit off-guard all the same, you don't just wake up one day and say "today is the day it finally happens" or anything like that.

Short answer? No. The elder magi had b.msgid: Short answer?  No.  The elder magi had been at this since before any of us came to truly understand The Path, before the first cracks in The Veil let a little light slip through.  I don't know for sure what caused it, and I don't care.  We just lasted long enough for the preparations to finally pay off.  World's gotta end eventually after all, and we got to be there to watch.

I was on a hunt. Not much to say about.msgid: I was on a hunt.  Not much to say about that, just another mage hunter making trouble.  Didn't get to finish my business with them.

What'd you expect, love blooming on the.msgid: What'd you expect, love blooming on the battlefield?  Something stole my kill, attracted a few guests along the way.  Not used to being the hunted.

The kind you don't want to invite to you.msgid: The kind you don't want to invite to your birthday party, for one.  Too noisy, no sense of personal space, have a bad habit of not staying dead, all the usual problems with the undead.  I legged it to report to the people that sent me, and that's about it.

Welcome. Try not to cause any trouble..msgid: Welcome.  Try not to cause any trouble.

We've nothing more to discuss. Leave..msgid: We've nothing more to discuss.  Leave.

…hunter. They wouldn't just send anythi.msgid: …hunter.  They wouldn't just send anything less than a fully hunting party.  Why are you here?

Well, aren't you a pleasant surprise to.msgid: Well, aren't you a pleasant surprise to see?  I'm aware of the hunters scouting out this place, tracking us.  But they let you through.  Why's that, I wonder?

The hunters sent you, didn't they? Unus.msgid: The hunters sent you, didn't they?  Unusual of them.  What angle are they getting at?

[MISSION] Do you have any information ab.msgid: [MISSION] Do you have any information about cursed ritual blades?

I was asked to bring back any research t.msgid: I was asked to bring back any research that would help us.

Do you have anything to trade?.msgid: Do you have anything to trade?

You must know of it, don't you? The mag.msgid: You must know of it, don't you?  The magi, the corruption ritual, the THING that drowned the last gasp of both our orders in a deluge of blood and madness.  I hope the magus that concocted that scheme died there with the priests and had his soul devoured by the abomination they ended up summoning.  Tell me, Keeper.  What answers do you seek?

I wonder how much you know about that..msgid: I wonder how much you know about that.  Brings to mind stories of the day our Order destroyed itself in its short-sightedness.  I can answer what questions you have.

That brings back memories of a fascinati.msgid: That brings back memories of a fascinating story, from the old days.  Of magi tampering with another order's sacred relic.  Practically blew up in their face, if I recall.  One of the incidents that encouraged us to break with the Sanguine Order.  What do you want to know about that old tale?

What did they do to the sword?.msgid: What did they do to the sword?

I need help undoing the curse put upon i.msgid: I need help undoing the curse put upon it.

They put a concealed curse on it. I don.msgid: They put a concealed curse on it.  I don't know for sure how it works, but it was geared towards sabotaging a Keeper communion ritual.  Lethal backlash, summoning some lesser hellspawn under their control, who knows?  Our order was on its last legs and some damn fool magus had a plan they thought would drag us back from the brink at the Keepers' expense.  Didn't work, obviously.

I see. As you were saying?.msgid: I see.  As you were saying?

From what little I heard, they drew the.msgid: From what little I heard, they drew the attention of some other being out them.  Some idiotic plot to sabotage the Keepers, drag them to Hell with us, I don't know what they were thinking nor what plans they had that would've benefited from it.  Only that the magus responsible for that plan got what they deserved.  I almost wish I was there to see it, though no one who made it out of there survived for very long…

I'm aware that your holy book includes c.msgid: I'm aware that your holy book includes consecration rituals that could be adapted to do that.  You'll likely need information on how the curse functions to properly fix it, some of it could perhaps be puzzled out from a copy of Sanguine Codex.

You'll need Keeper magic to fix Keeper r.msgid: You'll need Keeper magic to fix Keeper relics, that's for certain.  Very few magi had a handle on curse-binding for that matter, so you'll likely need a copy of the Codex on hand too.  Otherwise you're more likely to burn the curse out and turn it into a useless piece of metal.

I don't know if I can help you very dire.msgid: I don't know if I can help you very directly.  You'll need information on the curse itself first, from a copy of the Sanguine Codex.  Then you'll want the rituals the sword's old owners used for consecrating relics.  That's probably in their book, Oaths To The Chalice.

We don't just smash things with hammers,.msgid: We don't just smash things with hammers, believe it or not.  Rendering it safe yet functional would be a much better outcome.

We have more methods than mere destructi.msgid: We have more methods than mere destruction, and a reason for each method used.  Hence, not wishing to destroy this item.

So I'll need a copy of Sanguine Codex th.msgid: So I'll need a copy of Sanguine Codex then, great.

Do you have a copy of Sanguine Codex I c.msgid: Do you have a copy of Sanguine Codex I can use for that?

I'll try to figure it out..msgid: I'll try to figure it out.

I'm aware of that. Old habits aside, it.msgid: I'm aware of that.  Old habits aside, it's good to have a chance to work towards a common goal.  Guessing you'll need a copy of the Codex, then?  I'll trust you with one, if needed for the ritual.

I already have one. Thank you, though..msgid: I already have one.  Thank you, though.

You're full of surprises, it seems. I'l.msgid: You're full of surprises, it seems.  I'll overlook the question of where you got it.  Do try not to end up burning it, and hopefully that old sword will prove useful.

Yes, you will. I suppose I can afford t.msgid: Yes, you will.  I suppose I can afford to lend you one for that purpose.  I will trust you to take good care of it, understood?

There is no need. I already have one..msgid: There is no need.  I already have one.

I'll see about this another time..msgid: I'll see about this another time.

We'll see how this goes, then..msgid: We'll see how this goes, then.

Thank you. Good bye for now..msgid: Thank you.  Good bye for now.

There's something about you, hunter. So.msgid: There's something about you, hunter.  Something anomalous.  You're not just here on behalf of the Cleansing Flame, are you?  What is it you seek?

And what makes you think I would trust y.msgid: And what makes you think I would trust your intentions?  Your kind have destroyed so much, knowledge that could've been used to adapt and survive in these trying times.

I have used what methods I deem necessar.msgid: I have used what methods I deem necessary.  I am here to ensure our future, not just my own survival.

I am more than just a hunter, now. I un.msgid: I am more than just a hunter, now.  I understand the importance of working together, using any means necessary, to ensure humanity's survival.  Will you aid us with this?

We have a community that is thriving, ma.msgid: We have a community that is thriving, making developments to ensure our survival.  If humanity's survival is your focus as well, then we are not enemies.

If I had any ill intent here, you would.msgid: If I had any ill intent here, you would already be dead, and I would've simply taken what we're after.  Is that sufficient proof?

So that is why you seek information from.msgid: So that is why you seek information from us.  I guess will trust you with this.  The truth is, we seek to persevere and adapt as well.  That is the purpose of a shrike, to use what we have gained for the sake of others.  It's only now, after all this bloodshed, that it seems we can do more than protect the magi with this gift.

What are your people doing now, then?.msgid: What are your people doing now, then?

Perhaps we can work together. They main.msgid: Perhaps we can work together.  They mainly seek research, but we can potentially come to an agreement.

Surviving, primarily. If any others amo.msgid: Surviving, primarily.  If any others among the Order cause trouble for having left, we will defend ourselves as we see fit.

Then we don't have to fight. I can vouc.msgid: Then we don't have to fight.  I can vouch that your research won't be destroyed.

You are impatient. If you continue pres.msgid: You are impatient.  If you continue pressing this issue, we will lose our patience in this matter as well.

So be it, then. I will trust you on thi.msgid: So be it, then.  I will trust you on this.  Safe's in the back room, I'll let them know to have it open for you.  Take what you need, then be on your way.

Thank you. One more thing before I go….msgid: Thank you.  One more thing before I go…

Fine then. Don't disappoint me. Safe's.msgid: Fine then.  Don't disappoint me.  Safe's in the back, I'll have it opened up, get what you need.  I suppose I can also send someone to check things out at the place you're from.  We'll see if this cooperation actually pans out.

Perhaps you're right. I don't know if w.msgid: Perhaps you're right.  I don't know if we can all truly work together, but we'll see.  I'll send someone to check things out.  In the meantime, I'll have them open the safe that has a copy of our research, it's in the back room there.

I'm afraid I can't do this. I'll consul.msgid: I'm afraid I can't do this.  I'll consult with the others and we shall see, but this would be a grave risk to take.

I'm not foolish enough to believe you..msgid: I'm not foolish enough to believe you.  We have our ways.  We will not prey upon others as the Order has before, but we will not concede anything to you.  Leave in peace, while that is still an option.

You've got guts, I'll give you that. If.msgid: You've got guts, I'll give you that.  If we were still a part of the Order, they'd be spilled out across the floor by now.  Times have changed, and I suppose we can come to an agreement.

We don't have to fight. I can vouch tha.msgid: We don't have to fight.  I can vouch that your research won't be destroyed.

We can work together. They mainly seek.msgid: We can work together.  They mainly seek research, but there's no reason we can't make more of this.

And you trust that they will not simply.msgid: And you trust that they will not simply burn any information you bring back to them?

That is why they've sent you? Can you t.msgid: That is why they've sent you?  Can you truly trust their intentions?

Times are changing. We have to work tog.msgid: Times are changing.  We have to work together, like it or not.  Are you willing to trust me on this?

They're looking for information they can.msgid: They're looking for information they can use to improve their chances of survival, same as both of us.

We are not enemies. We can work togethe.msgid: We are not enemies.  We can work together, combine our knowledge to survive.

They have a thriving community, and are.msgid: They have a thriving community, and are working to secure a future for anyone who will work with them.  We can work together.

Enough talk. Just hand it over and ther.msgid: Enough talk.  Just hand it over and there won't be any trouble.

We are those who hunt the hunters, those.msgid: We are those who hunt the hunters, those who once threatened our order.  Those days are behind us.  For too long have we squandered our power, protecting people who use their gifts for self-destructive purposes.  We prey upon the abominations that stalk this world now, and defend ourselves as we see fit.

The others seem to be in more convention.msgid: The others seem to be in more conventional equipment.  Why the mantle of shadows?

Then we have no reason to be enemies. O.msgid: Then we have no reason to be enemies.  Our goals are aligned.

You're observant, I'll give you that. I.msgid: You're observant, I'll give you that.  It was a gift, from one of their priests I suspect is probably dead by now.  A reminder of the days before the Order drove itself into ruin, before they betrayed the Keepers.  That's all I'm willing to speak of such times.  The future is more important now.

An old hideout of sorts, we'd bring supp.msgid: An old hideout of sorts, we'd bring supplies and other materials by every so often, arrange for meetings between major sects of the Order, and all that.

Is there a risk that the magi might find.msgid: Is there a risk that the magi might find this place?

What's with the items on the shelf?.msgid: What's with the items on the shelf?

They certainly know, but we've done quit.msgid: They certainly know, but we've done quite a bit to send a clear message that this hideout is lost to them if they intend to cause trouble.

Some items that have been traded around.msgid: Some items that have been traded around among our old suppliers, and some surplus equipment.  I suppose I could do without it, it's not like we need most of it.  It's not going anywhere else, as it is.

What do you know of other practices, oth.msgid: What do you know of other practices, other strange powers?

I know not of what you ask. I merely ga.msgid: I know not of what you ask.  I merely gather the bones to hear their song.  There are perhaps other verses to gather, but they can lead one astray.

There is much I can teach, as recompense.msgid: There is much I can teach, as recompense for the lesson you have taught me.  My master wishes that I spread His word.

Morbid as your practice is, there is no.msgid: Morbid as your practice is, there is no actual magic in them.  This is a mere religious rite.

You seek power in life. Whether it be b.msgid: You seek power in life.  Whether it be bones, flesh, or blood, there are far greater truths to learn.

Look at me. You have surely seen mutant.msgid: Look at me.  You have surely seen mutants before, but there is something deeper than that here.  Power from beyond this world made me this way.

Perhaps there are other things to learn.msgid: Perhaps there are other things to learn from studying the bones, especially of things touched by the Beyond.

I have my beliefs that I keep close to h.msgid: I have my beliefs that I keep close to heart, but I will not deny you your vision.  So long as it does not impede my work.  What purpose do you pursue?

I would ask to show you the potential wi.msgid: I would ask to show you the potential within The Beyond.

Do you know of the powers from Beyond, t.msgid: Do you know of the powers from Beyond, that seek their myriad goals?

There is potential within many things, b.msgid: There is potential within many things, but few things hold the same permanence.  I know nothing of whatever it is you seek, only that it is beholden to the cycle in ways that the bones are not.

Perhaps I could show you something that.msgid: Perhaps I could show you something that would enlighten you, as you have enlightened me.

So you claim. Perhaps another time, I w.msgid: So you claim.  Perhaps another time, I will show you the hidden truths.

Is that so? I'm listening, then..msgid: Is that so?  I'm listening, then.

What do you make of this? It's a fang f.msgid: What do you make of this?  It's a fang from a monster that doesn't belong in this world, made of otherworldly crystal.

What about this? A fang torn from an ot.msgid: What about this?  A fang torn from an otherworldly monster.

These bones are a twisted knot of otherw.msgid: These bones are a twisted knot of otherworldly presence.  Would this prove my point?

These are the finger bones of a creature.msgid: These are the finger bones of a creature touched by The Beyond.  Would that suffice?

What do you make of this? It's a root w.msgid: What do you make of this?  It's a root with the otherworldly woven into its every fiber.

This is a bloom touched by the Beyond..msgid: This is a bloom touched by the Beyond.  Would this be adequate?

This is a spike of otherworldly living m.msgid: This is a spike of otherworldly living metal, would this show you something new?

This twisted barb was taken from somethi.msgid: This twisted barb was taken from something that does not belong in this world.

This crystal fragment has an otherworldl.msgid: This crystal fragment has an otherworldly presence to it.  What do you make of it?

This piece of crystal is some sort of un.msgid: This piece of crystal is some sort of unnatural amber.  Would this work?

This piece of crystal was shed from an o.msgid: This piece of crystal was shed from an otherworldly creature, would it be sufficient?

This dark gem holds the unliving presenc.msgid: This dark gem holds the unliving presence of the creature it was taken from.  Show me what you see.

This fragment of hide is tainted with ot.msgid: This fragment of hide is tainted with otherworldly presence.  What do you make of it?

This piece of an otherworldly creature's.msgid: This piece of an otherworldly creature's hide still reflects the influence of the Beyond.

This stone is etched with a living recor.msgid: This stone is etched with a living record of the supernatural influence that shaped it.

Here. A stony heart ripped from a creat.msgid: Here.  A stony heart ripped from a creature that was pulled from another world.  Many people died for this, what does it sing to you?

I'm not sure what would be fitting. Ano.msgid: I'm not sure what would be fitting.  Another time perhaps.

How peculiar. Normally I would consider.msgid: How peculiar.  Normally I would consider this to be foolish, for what songs can stone sing?  But I can hear its whispers, it's like a song in another language, yet it sings like bones all the same.  I don't know how I could repay you for such a thing, but would you be willing to part with it?

I can't part with it just yet. I'm sorr.msgid: I can't part with it just yet.  I'm sorry.

Thank you. I will need some time to gat.msgid: Thank you.  I will need some time to gather its songs.  Perhaps you are correct, that there is more to this than what I have witnessed.  These verses are so far beyond my experience, there is surely great strength in them…

We still have much to discuss, if you do.msgid: We still have much to discuss, if you don't mind.

You're welcome. That's all for now, the.msgid: You're welcome.  That's all for now, then.

I see. You have my curiosity, regardles.msgid: I see.  You have my curiosity, regardless.  Another time, then.  I need to hear what you have heard, see if there is merit in the verses these peculiar bones sing.

Ivory, more transient and fleeting than.msgid: Ivory, more transient and fleeting than bones, but aligned all the same.  I can hear the whispered verses though, this thing sings with a resonance I've never heard before.  If there is any truth to the strange things you've said, I must find out for myself.  Please, I don't think I can repay you properly for this, but would you be willing to part with that?

Even among the shambling undead, I have.msgid: Even among the shambling undead, I have never seen such discord and strife within their bones.  You can practically read the verses etched into every tangled surface, what could create such a thing?  Please, you must give it to me.  I don't know if I could repay you for such a kindness…

Ah, this is a very traditional manner of.msgid: Ah, this is a very traditional manner of hearing the songs, of grasping the power within.  But these hum with verses I have never heard before.  Is this true, that there is something more to learn from these bones?  I cannot repay you for this, but please.  If you would be willing to part with them…

Perhaps there is something akin to life.msgid: Perhaps there is something akin to life in this petrified thing, something akin to a song.  But it is a distant, hushed song.  Atonal are the melodies of that which never knew life in the first place.  I'm afraid I can not do anything with this.

Though it sings, and with a most peculia.msgid: Though it sings, and with a most peculiar melody, it is a fleeting song.  The hushed tones of flesh and skin, of bark and rotting wood.  Such songs are too transient and fleeting to be of value to me.

Interesting, but transient and fleeting.msgid: Interesting, but transient and fleeting as songs of flesh are.  Even if it is at once stout and echoing like songs of stone, yet carries the melody living flesh possesses, I do not think it would last as the melodies of bone do.  Even if I did wish to learn its song, I feel you may find more use for it than I would.  It would not be right to ask you to part with this thing.

Of that, I am sure even though I do not.msgid: Of that, I am sure even though I do not know their names.  But they are all beholden to the cycles that we are trapped in.

I could show you something you might be.msgid: I could show you something you might be able to learn from.

Perhaps you're right. We'll see, in tim.msgid: Perhaps you're right.  We'll see, in time.

This is more than ritual. You have hear.msgid: This is more than ritual.  You have heard the songs, haven't you?  What more do you need?

I could show you something that might ex.msgid: I could show you something that might explain what I speak of.

Nevermind. There's no point in arguing.msgid: Nevermind.  There's no point in arguing over it.

I do not gather the strength in these bo.msgid: I do not gather the strength in these bones, amass the Song, simply out of lust for power.  This is my duty, to gather the verses, together with my Kindred.

There is something I could show you, tha.msgid: There is something I could show you, that makes the power of your so-called song look like child's play.

I have no time to spare for disproving y.msgid: I have no time to spare for disproving your delusions.  I've nothing more to say to you.

Whatever form your flesh takes, undernea.msgid: Whatever form your flesh takes, underneath your power is the same as it always has been.  As it always shall be.  No matter which face you bear, whose name you answer to, the bones are of the same substance.  From now, until this cycle is broken.

I don't think my bones are the same as t.msgid: I don't think my bones are the same as they were, as different as they are now, along with everything else.

But, there is something more to this. I.msgid: But, there is something more to this.  I could show you.

You know nothing of true power. I have.msgid: You know nothing of true power.  I have no interest in trying to talk you out of your folly.

You think too literally of it. If your.msgid: You think too literally of it.  If your way of thinking about it was true, then to lose a limb would make you of different substance.  Underneath it all, it is the song being sung which transcends your petty distinctions.

Fine then. But maybe I still have somet.msgid: Fine then.  But maybe I still have something that would prove my point.

Perhaps this is true. But underneath th.msgid: Perhaps this is true.  But underneath the pollution that undeath brings, the bones still speak their songs.  It is harder for the inexperienced to decipher them, but their true nature is fundamentally unchanged.  I'm curious though, what lesson do you think remains unlearned?

I might have something that would explai.msgid: I might have something that would explain things better.

Another time perhaps, I will need to thi.msgid: Another time perhaps, I will need to think on this.

Perhaps this is true. But what certaint.msgid: Perhaps this is true.  But what certainty do you have that any mortal hand can end this cycle?

You speak a dangerous folly, destruction.msgid: You speak a dangerous folly, destruction of the world.

I am not alone in this task. No matter.msgid: I am not alone in this task.  No matter how many deaths my flesh endures, I will carry on my work.  As many times as it takes.  Interesting, however, that you speak as though there are things beyond mortal means, unfazed by the cycle.  The cycle is all-encompassing.  All that may live, whether or not they were ever born, is beholden to this.

There is another who has assigned a task.msgid: There is another who has assigned a task of great purpose.  Perhaps in time, our missions will align.

I have a mission of my own, we'll see if.msgid: I have a mission of my own, we'll see if it leads us down the same path.

We shall see if this holds true..msgid: We shall see if this holds true.

I do not know what purpose you pursue th.msgid: I do not know what purpose you pursue this task, but I am reluctant to believe this.  There is much work to be done, and many false omens to lead us astray.

If you insist. There is more to discuss.msgid: If you insist.  There is more to discuss, however.

So you say. That is all for now, then..msgid: So you say.  That is all for now, then.

We cling to our lives, even knowing we h.msgid: We cling to our lives, even knowing we have suffered a thousand deaths.  Only time will tell what future awaits us when this cycle is broken, but is it not better for us, that we be freed of this torment?

You will find nothing but misery, pursui.msgid: You will find nothing but misery, pursuing this madness.  I will not stop you.

[ATTACK] I cannot allow you to continue.msgid: [ATTACK] I cannot allow you to continue this.  If there is any truth to your delusions, it will only bring more suffering.

This reeks of blood magic. Do you even.msgid: This reeks of blood magic.  Do you even understand what you are asking of me?

I suspect it is you who does not underst.msgid: I suspect it is you who does not understand.  This is understandable, but this is why I offer you this chance to learn the verses the bones seek to sing.  I know not of what you called it, but this is not a thing of blood.  Blood is an impure thing, far too transient to offer worthy songs.  It is shed wantonly, and does not hold the permanence that bones carry with them.

If you insist, we'll see. Explain again.msgid: If you insist, we'll see.  Explain again what you're asking of me.

I need time to consider this..msgid: I need time to consider this.

[ATTACK] You are treading dangerously cl.msgid: [ATTACK] You are treading dangerously close to things you do not truly understand.  I can't let you corrupt anyone else.  Ecce, sanguinem magum…

Can you teach me any spells?.msgid: Can you teach me any spells?

I myself don't know anything about that,.msgid: I myself don't know anything about that, actually.  However, seek the contact your friend Sofia sent you to speak with, responsible for our meeting.  He might be able to help.

A student, basically. Of the same sort.msgid: A student, basically.  Of the same sort of phenomena that the people here have studied.  I would prefer such knowledge be shared rather than hoarded, though.

What sorts of phenomena are you familiar.msgid: What sorts of phenomena are you familiar with?

What do you mean, we hoard knowledge?.msgid: What do you mean, we hoard knowledge?

The amount of formal training I had was.msgid: The amount of formal training I had was rather limited.  I was an apprentice under a scholar for about two years, until all this started.  Beyond that, all I have is what I've learned through observation.

I understand your fear. We must ensure.msgid: I understand your fear.  We must ensure that future generations are not left blind to what challenges await them.

Knowledge is both a valuable tool, and p.msgid: Knowledge is both a valuable tool, and potentially a weapon if misused.  I will do what I can to ensure what we learn isn't lost.

I'll see what I can do to help. We can'.msgid: I'll see what I can do to help.  We can't afford to lose such valuable information.

We'll have to see how things go, I guess.msgid: We'll have to see how things go, I guess.

Thank you for that. Sofia, others here,.msgid: Thank you for that.  Sofia, others here, they seem to know that this knowledge can enrich the lives of other survivors too.  I'll have to trust them to lead the way in doing so.

I'm not that familiar with this place, o.msgid: I'm not that familiar with this place, only really found out about it from other survivors.  Some with experience in otherworldly matters, who could confirm this place was a refuge for others who seek knowledge.

What other survivors came along with you.msgid: What other survivors came along with you?

There were a couple others who visited t.msgid: There were a couple others who visited the traders then left.  Only other arrival to stay would be the cowboy.  He's usually loitering outside.

Yeah, an honest-to-God cowboy. Seems to.msgid: Yeah, an honest-to-God cowboy.  Seems to be a mercenary looking for work, good shot and rather tough for his age.  He helped out when the caravan was attacked by monsters along the way.

Aside from study and any other work I ca.msgid: Aside from study and any other work I can get, I also have supplies I trade around, helps supplement my efforts to gather new materials and books to ready.  Anything you'd like?

Sure, let's see what you have..msgid: Sure, let's see what you have.

I know a few tricks I could teach you, M.msgid: I know a few tricks I could teach you, Magic Signs as they've been called.  The arts of Agility, Conjure Flame, and Displacement.  If you have the coin, I'll put the materials and such together to help with learning the spell pattern.  Same sort of Golden Scales the others here use.

What can you tell me about Agility?.msgid: What can you tell me about Agility?

What can you tell me about Conjure Flame.msgid: What can you tell me about Conjure Flame?

What can you tell me about Displacement?.msgid: What can you tell me about Displacement?

I already know all of those, thanks anyw.msgid: I already know all of those, thanks anyway.

It's a fairly simple spell that increase.msgid: It's a fairly simple spell that increases dexterity, and affects your speed as well.  I've gotten out of some close scrapes in the past using it on myself and occasionally traveling partners.  I'll teach it to you for 3 Golden Scales.

I'll need more Scales for that. Maybe l.msgid: I'll need more Scales for that.  Maybe later.

Whatever area you target with it goes up.msgid: Whatever area you target with it goes up in flames.  Its damage is best when you center it on whatever you want dead, just be careful since it can blow out windows or otherwise wreck the place.  Not to mention accidentally blowing up your ally or burning your house down wouldn't be a good idea.  I'll teach it to you for 3 Golden Scales.

Pick a target, and instantly swap places.msgid: Pick a target, and instantly swap places with them.  Not only will they be left staggered afterward, but so will anyone standing near where you emerge.  I'll teach it to you for 3 Golden Scales.

Are you… dressed up like a cowboy?.msgid: Are you… dressed up like a cowboy?

I heard what y'all are up to. Ran into.msgid: I heard what y'all are up to.  Ran into one what these fellas are lookin' for myself last patrol, picked off one and left the other chasin' squirrels.  I'll tell the padre here what I've found out, you just keep askin' around.  Take care now.

I'm just a ol' hired hand. So long as t.msgid: I'm just a ol' hired hand.  So long as there's good pay, I do what needs t' be done.

What kind of work do you do?.msgid: What kind of work do you do?

Can you tell me anything else about your.msgid: Can you tell me anything else about yourself?

What would it cost to hire you?.msgid: What would it cost to hire you?

Mercenary work, these days. Guarding ca.msgid: Mercenary work, these days.  Guarding caravans, bit of firepower for a posse, that sorta thing.  Still have a good eye with hunting rifles, even if it's getting harder to read clearly.

Used to work on a ranch out of state, al.msgid: Used to work on a ranch out of state, also grew up hunting.  Fought like hell to get up here, way everything went down I'm surprised I'm still kicking.  Lot of hard fights and strange shit along the way.

What can you tell me about Golden Scales.msgid: What can you tell me about Golden Scales?

Golden Scales are those little coins the.msgid: Golden Scales are those little coins the locals here use.  Seems it's picking up as a currency.  Personally I'd prefer silver dollars if we're talking hard cash, but you use what you can get if you don't like bartering your shirt away for a hot meal.  These people seem to have some other use for em, too.

I see. Let's try this again from the st.msgid: I see.  Let's try this again from the start.

Okay, how much do I need?.msgid: Okay, how much do I need?

Well, thanks for the info. Bye!.msgid: Well, thanks for the info.  Bye!

Yep. Used to be a ranch hand, and it's.msgid: Yep.  Used to be a ranch hand, and it's still practical for wandering the wastes.  Unholy abominations don't care so much about fancy plate carriers, and anything that'll stop a rifle bullet slows you down.

[MISSION] I spoke with Sofia. They're d.msgid: [MISSION] I spoke with Sofia.  They're doing alright, so far.

[MISSION] Sofia asked me to find additio.msgid: [MISSION] Sofia asked me to find additional trade partners and labor to help build the outpost they're working on.  Can you give me any advice?

I assume that Sofia or one of her compat.msgid: I assume that Sofia or one of her compatriots has asked you to look into this matter.  I recently had to administer the Viaticum to an gravely injured man, the only survivor of an attack a few miles down the road.  They were in too much shock to recount what happened, but I recognized the signs of deep frostbite around the neck and chest, even through his armor, and severe fractures without lacerations or bruises.
