As I said, to reverse what has happened may never truly be possible.  You are free to seek that if you desire, but fulfilling the sword's purpose will serve either goal.

If you insist. What am I to do?.msgid: If you insist.  What am I to do?

I would ask you to pursue this task furt.msgid: I would ask you to pursue this task further, but there is a complication.  You are aware that certain influences, certain powers, can leave their mark on the body, correct?

While we seek an understanding of the Be.msgid: While we seek an understanding of the Beyond, do not forget our humanity…

You would quote the very tenet you faile.msgid: You would quote the very tenet you failed to uphold?  I can tell, plain as the look in your eyes, that you've abandoned your humanity.  There is a reason we forbid this.  To uphold His oath will put us on a path of conflict, a war for the whole of our world, for our enemies will be many.

It is His will, that we remain free of m.msgid: It is His will, that we remain free of mutation?

Is there any way I can regain His favor?.msgid: Is there any way I can regain His favor?

It is not that your form has strayed fro.msgid: It is not that your form has strayed from the natural path.  It is the fact that these influences make your body dependent on forces that do not belong in this world.  If you are bound to the enemy, then there is a risk that your life will depend on their continued influence on this world.  We will never be able to truly reverse the damage that has been done, but mending our world might be a grave risk to those too closely tied to the Beyond.

I do not fear dying, if it means the res.msgid: I do not fear dying, if it means the rest of us don't go extinct.

Is there any way I can make up for this?.msgid: Is there any way I can make up for this?

I see. I won't trouble you further..msgid: I see.  I won't trouble you further.

I admire your commitment. But you have.msgid: I admire your commitment.  But you have already wavered, strayed from what is proper.  This is out of my hands, and out of yours.

Is there anything we can do?.msgid: Is there anything we can do?

I see. I'll do what I can, then..msgid: I see.  I'll do what I can, then.

There are others, perhaps in time they w.msgid: There are others, perhaps in time they will come here.  If you were to go forth, foster our faith, we may yet be able to find someone suitable.  I will reward you as best as I can, if you are willing to leave the blade in my care.

Very well then. Here you go..msgid: Very well then.  Here you go.

I don't have it at the moment, but I can.msgid: I don't have it at the moment, but I can bring it back to you another time.

I hope that you truly do. If you sought.msgid: I hope that you truly do.  If you sought to serve Him while you are so thoroughly tethered to the Beyond, it may well be the death of you.

I'll do whatever it takes, even if it's.msgid: I'll do whatever it takes, even if it's risky.

What can I do to make up for this?.msgid: What can I do to make up for this?

Simple, young one. The intrusions upon.msgid: Simple, young one.  The intrusions upon this world have threatened us all, inflicted us with influences that may never truly be erased.  The more you are tied to these powers however, the less suitable you are to serve as His Chosen.

So your god doesn't accept mutants?.msgid: So your god doesn't accept mutants?

Is there anything I can do to fix this?.msgid: Is there anything I can do to fix this?

I am glad that you are prepared to help.msgid: I am glad that you are prepared to help me with this.  The relic you now possess represents the legacy of those who have come before you.  I fear I am not long for this world, but you still have a chance.  I will guide you as best as I can.

There was another who sought to help me,.msgid: There was another who sought to help me, but ultimately could not finish the life's work of my order.  They entrusted this relic to me, the last of our holy weapons as far as I am aware.  It may help you, if you are willing to take good care of it.

I am thankful for your offer. There was.msgid: I am thankful for your offer.  There was another who came by here, once.  I guided them as best as I could, to help me with some unfinished business before I can allow myself to rest, but we have failed once more.  There was a sword, one of our order's holy weapons.  A greatsword with sacred runes engraved along the blade.  If you ever find it again, I will fill you in on what this unfinished business entails.

Tell me what needs to be done with this.msgid: Tell me what needs to be done with this sword.

This is very dangerous magic under your.msgid: This is very dangerous magic under your care.  Are you certain this is wise?

You are asking me to join your cult, Kee.msgid: You are asking me to join your cult, Keeper.

I accept. What needs to be done?.msgid: I accept.  What needs to be done?

Your order's work? What was that?.msgid: Your order's work?  What was that?

So there is hope for us yet. Anything e.msgid: So there is hope for us yet.  Anything else?

I will need time to think about this..msgid: I will need time to think about this.

It has the power to draw upon the energy.msgid: It has the power to draw upon the energy lingering in holes in reality, the portals that remain.  The damage has already been done, but this is one step that may enable us to regain some degree of control, and ensure the continued existence of our world, not to mention the survival of humanity.  Use the power that this act grants you, and you will see for yourself what follows.  You will know when the full fruit of this effort has been rewarded, seek me out when this has occurred.

Gods and demons enslaving us are what ca.msgid: Gods and demons enslaving us are what caused this mess, you old fool.

We will not fail. As is His will..msgid: We will not fail.  As is His will.

This power is dangerous. Why should we.msgid: This power is dangerous.  Why should we trust that salvation lay with yet another interloper?

I still have my concerns, but we shall s.msgid: I still have my concerns, but we shall see what can be done.

You are mistaken. Human hands brought t.msgid: You are mistaken.  Human hands brought this upon our world.  I know that your order's practice did not spark this, despite the Cleansing Flame's accusations.  But some manmade cause inflicted this, and we need all the help we can get.  After what your order did to my brethren, I am still willing to trust you, but you need to trust me as well.

You are faithful to all the gods, young.msgid: You are faithful to all the gods, young one.  You will see that this relic, if used with care, is safe now that the damage to it has been healed.  We are not enemies, Hunter.  I will trust you to do the right thing.

[ATTACK] I cannot allow this to continue.msgid: [ATTACK] I cannot allow this to continue.  It must be destroyed.

You can surely discern a dangerous artif.msgid: You can surely discern a dangerous artifact, experienced as you are.  But do not forgot, I am well-versed in the ways of our order as well.  This weapon had suffered damage at the hands of the Sanguine Order, but it has been cleansed.  I know also that you are reluctant to use this for its intended purpose, but please.  I am willing to trust you with it, as I know you will do the right thing.

Very well then, Keeper. We shall see wh.msgid: Very well then, Keeper.  We shall see what will come of this.

[ATTACK] I do not know if this relic can.msgid: [ATTACK] I do not know if this relic can be consecrated properly, but I would rather it be destroyed than risk causing further disruption.

I'm not certain if this is the right way.msgid: I'm not certain if this is the right way, Keeper.  I will need time to think.

I am asking you to do the right thing..msgid: I am asking you to do the right thing.  What is it your order says?  "No holy symbol or icon shall hold sway over those who follow The Path."  This is your choice to make, and yours alone.  If you accept this, you will have the means to survive that you seek, and you'll be able to do some good with this old relic.

These powers are but another tool at our.msgid: These powers are but another tool at our disposal, we also say.  Fine, I'll play along.

[ATTACK] You are a slave to this thing..msgid: [ATTACK] You are a slave to this thing.  Better you join the rest of your cult in death.

I'll consider it. Not right now..msgid: I'll consider it.  Not right now.

Thank you. Keep this relic safe in the.msgid: Thank you.  Keep this relic safe in the meantime.  As you travel, you will find the portals left over from when this all started.  Stand before them with the relic in your possession, and soon you will see what must be done.  In time, all will be answered.  Speak with me if you need any further advice.

We sought to do what little we could to.msgid: We sought to do what little we could to salve the wounds in The Veil that still fester.  The Cleansing Flame, another group experienced with the Beyond, had their own methods.  Flawed ones, but not without merit.  In time, if you accept this blade and seek out the portals left behind, you will find the answers you seek.  It may not be enough to save humanity.  But it's one way to help, among many.

There is always hope, young one. As the.msgid: There is always hope, young one.  As the mage hunters would put it, so long as the Sun shines upon the Earth.  I entrust you with the last of the seven relics.  May He From Beyond The Veil guard and guide you, that you be anointed His Chosen.

We have struggled so long, through so mu.msgid: We have struggled so long, through so much death and pain, hoping first to stave off this apocalypse, then to ensure the survival of this world despite countless tears in the fabric of reality.  Let others ensure that humanity carries on, we had our own way to secure this world's future.  But now, it's slipped out of my grasp once more.  It was only through seeing one of my order's holy relics, restored to its former glory, that I had been able to find the strength to carry on.  We shall see if we get another chance…

\"No matter the cost, no matter what we.msgid: "No matter the cost, no matter what we must do, for the strength and safety of this world.  And in turn, of worlds beyond."  We will persevere.

I don't know what will come of this, Kee.msgid: I don't know what will come of this, Keeper, but it is admirable that you still hold on.  We are not extinct just yet, relic or no relic.

So you have succeeded while I, and other.msgid: So you have succeeded while I, and others, have failed.  I continued to hold on to hope, and now at last I see it bear fruit.  No doubt you will have questions, speak with me when you're ready and I will answer them as best as I am able.

I'm impressed, young one. He From Beyon.msgid: I'm impressed, young one.  He From Beyond The Veil has sought to bring us hope in these dark times.  To see such a thing, after all that has come to pass, is a relief to my old heart.  Come, we will have much to discuss.

So that is why you are here. Another so.msgid: So that is why you are here.  Another sought to finish His work, and I failed them.  But here you are, Chosen by He From Beyond The Veil, guided here to continue our work?  I am in your debt.  I will answer what questions you may have, best as I am able.

What? Such strange fate, that would gui.msgid: What?  Such strange fate, that would guide you here.  I had feared that I was the last of my order, that there was no hope left for us.  Fate has seen me proven wrong, it seems.  Well then, if you have questions, speak to me when you're ready.

Indeed. Hopefully you have seen for you.msgid: Indeed.  Hopefully you have seen for yourself what this relic can do, even in the poor state it's in.  With it, another can at least continue to fulfill our oath.  To do all we can to ensure this world is not cast into the abyss, and others with it.  If you believe yourself ready…

Why another? Why can't you do this?.msgid: Why another?  Why can't you do this?

I've no further questions for now. We'l.msgid: I've no further questions for now.  We'll see what I can do.

Well, what my brethren and I have sworn..msgid: Well, what my brethren and I have sworn.  While I have no authority to administer the holy vows, you have started down a path that, if followed to its conclusion, will serve the same purpose.  You will have something that very few of us have ever achieved.

And what did you say of the abyss?.msgid: And what did you say of the abyss?

That should be all the answers I need fo.msgid: That should be all the answers I need for now.

I'm well past my prime. You've already.msgid: I'm well past my prime.  You've already proven yourself capable and worthy of His favor.  Better that I do what I can, to guide you down the right path.

Alright. That is all for now..msgid: Alright.  That is all for now.

That is what Oaths to The Chalice warns.msgid: That is what Oaths to The Chalice warns of, why He answered our plea all those years ago.  Not just for our sake, but that of other worlds affected by the wounds in The Veil.

So you believe that He From Beyond The V.msgid: So you believe that He From Beyond The Veil wants the portals closed?

Why should we care about whatever form o.msgid: Why should we care about whatever form of Hell these monsters come from?

Perhaps. It is hard to be certain of go.msgid: Perhaps.  It is hard to be certain of gods, earthly or otherworldly.  No doubt other powerful beings from Beyond have no such concern, but is it because they believe there will be no such consequences, or are they ignorant of them?  Or worse, eager to see what havoc may afflict other planes of existence?  These are questions no mortal mind can answer with certainty, only that at least one of these powers has an interest in deeds that benefit us, no matter His true intent.

I can understand why it would be hard to.msgid: I can understand why it would be hard to care.  Most of the intruders from Beyond seem as mere animals at best, and most of the others seem to desire nothing but misery and extinction for us all.  But among them all, some spirits, some gods, demons, whatever they may be, would see us survive and endure the dark days ahead of us.  Whether they act in self-interest or not, it's better to have a powerful ally than to cower in the shadows of unnameable horrors.

If you say so. Guess I'm ready..msgid: If you say so.  Guess I'm ready.

I've no more tasks I can offer you. You.msgid: I've no more tasks I can offer you.  Your path is your own, though under the guidance of He From Beyond The Veil.  However, if you have questions that remain, I will help as best as I can.

I worry for what my brethren will think….msgid: I worry for what my brethren will think…

How amusing it is, a blood mage as one o.msgid: How amusing it is, a blood mage as one of your order's Chosen.

I can hear whispers in the back of my mi.msgid: I can hear whispers in the back of my mind, strange fragments of dreams I can't recall clearly.

What remains of the Keepers of The Oath?.msgid: What remains of the Keepers of The Oath?

Why did the blood mages betray you, anyw.msgid: Why did the blood mages betray you, anyway?

Will sealing these portals really ensure.msgid: Will sealing these portals really ensure humanity's survival?

We are not enemies, at least no longer..msgid: We are not enemies, at least no longer.  Though some may wish to destroy the relic, what reason would they have?  As your holy book declares, if it is unsafe to study, then destroy it.  But you have seen quite well what it does, and can confirm it is safe.

True. I have another thing to ask about.msgid: True.  I have another thing to ask about.

True. That is all for now..msgid: True.  That is all for now.

Amusing indeed. No god, no demon, whate.msgid: Amusing indeed.  No god, no demon, whatever it is the Sanguine Codex says.  And yet, what you have received is justly-earned.  You are not a servant, but His Chosen.

Right. I have another thing to ask abou.msgid: Right.  I have another thing to ask about.

Right. That is all for now..msgid: Right.  That is all for now.

The other Chosen wrote about hearing His.msgid: The other Chosen wrote about hearing His will, described mention of receiving divine inspiration through dream and omen.  This was one of the other advantages of the relics, being able to follow His commands, without needing sacrifice and ritual to sustain communion with Him.  If they are muddled and unclear, that may be another consequence of the Sanguine Order's work on the relic.  Even then, so long as you do what you're able to, I am hopeful that He will be pleased.

Aside from closing portals, what else mi.msgid: Aside from closing portals, what else might serve Him?

I have another thing to ask about..msgid: I have another thing to ask about.

He has spoken of driving back the influe.msgid: He has spoken of driving back the influence of other intrusions upon this realm, of returning the restless dead to their proper state, of paving the way for humanity's survival in the face of adversity.  I do not know if His will is truly out of love for humanity, but even if it isn't, if we are driven to extinction then who would ensure His will is enforced?  What dire consequences may occur should the fabric of reality deteriorate further, and no one remains to prevent it?

I see. I have another thing to ask abou.msgid: I see.  I have another thing to ask about.

There are others. I am certain of it..msgid: There are others.  I am certain of it.  So long as even one of us remains, and so long as our oath endures in the written word, we won't be dying out anytime soon.  You could ask the same of the earthly faiths that have come before.

Got it. I have another thing to ask abo.msgid: Got it.  I have another thing to ask about.

Okay. That is all for now..msgid: Okay.  That is all for now.

We had power, a sanctum that we would've.msgid: We had power, a sanctum that we would've been willing to share with them, potentially the means to rebuild.  That was their folly, seeing a chance to take what they sought in a single act, when we could've sheltered them.

You learned the hard way, not to trust t.msgid: You learned the hard way, not to trust the Sanguine Order.

And our actions doomed us both..msgid: And our actions doomed us both.

Oh. That is all for now..msgid: Oh.  That is all for now.

Perhaps. But we had our reasons for doi.msgid: Perhaps.  But we had our reasons for doing so.  You may have known them as nothing but cannibalistic, human-sacrificing monsters, but the causes of ambition are many, and so are the ways in which one pursues it.  They were no less unified in their conduct than your own order was.

Perhaps. We still live, however. Perha.msgid: Perhaps.  We still live, however.  Perhaps this, a sanguine Chosen and an old Keeper, is proof that such betrayal wasn't the inevitable outcome of sheltering them…

Survival of humanity will depend on all.msgid: Survival of humanity will depend on all those who still live.  There are countless threats to overcome.  It may be that humanity thrives and adapts even if we do not pursue our duty.  It may also be that the fabric of The Veil remains endangered no matter what we do.  But His will is that we seek to ensure those who survive have every advantage possible.  Your duty as His Chosen still does good for this world, even if these dire consequences never come to pass.

Alright. I have another thing to ask ab.msgid: Alright.  I have another thing to ask about.

So be it. That is all for now..msgid: So be it.  That is all for now.

Yet humanity perseveres, and there are s.msgid: Yet humanity perseveres, and there are still those of us out there to serve His will.

What can you tell me of He From Beyond T.msgid: What can you tell me of He From Beyond The Veil?

A scholar? What kinds of books do you h.msgid: A scholar?  What kinds of books do you have?

Indeed. Despite it all, there is still.msgid: Indeed.  Despite it all, there is still hope.  Hope not just for the survival of humanity or our faith, but that our deeds will please Him, and ensure it hasn't all been in vain.  Thank you.

The one we have sworn an oath to. The f.msgid: The one we have sworn an oath to.  The full extent of His power and His purpose for us was only clear to the high priests, but we all saw the good that serving Him brought.  Much of it entailed things the Cleansing Flame would've approved of, seeking to mend the worsening wounds in The Veil, driving back intruders from Beyond…

Keeping the faith alive still holds meri.msgid: Keeping the faith alive still holds merit in these dark times, if nothing else.

Hardly trivial, every book has some meri.msgid: Hardly trivial, every book has some merit to it.

Trivial indeed, nothing worth learning t.msgid: Trivial indeed, nothing worth learning that you can't learn from experience.  Suit yourself, old man.

Various faiths of the old world. I've a.msgid: Various faiths of the old world.  I've always been more a scholar then a theologian, but some insights can be glimpsed in such writings.  Of both the old gods, and the new gods.

An understanding we both share. I was b.msgid: An understanding we both share.  I was brought up among a mix of diverse teachings, united in our goal.

I see. I was taught not to trust any po.msgid: I see.  I was taught not to trust any power beyond ones own means.

Understandable. I learned the ways of o.msgid: Understandable.  I learned the ways of one of said new gods.

To mend the growing wounds in The Veil..msgid: To mend the growing wounds in The Veil.

To protect humanity, so long as the Sun.msgid: To protect humanity, so long as the Sun shines upon the Earth.

To destroy dangerous magic, and dangerou.msgid: To destroy dangerous magic, and dangerous users of it.

I'm just a survivor, these days..msgid: I'm just a survivor, these days.

A worthy cause. We share a common goal,.msgid: A worthy cause.  We share a common goal, Hunter.  That is what you are, correct?  I may have a task to offer you then, that suits both of our goals.

Very well then. We shall see….msgid: Very well then.  We shall see…

So I see, Hunter. I am familiar with yo.msgid: So I see, Hunter.  I am familiar with your tenets, even as a follower of He From Beyond The Veil.  You knew all along, I bet.  We need not be enemies.  In fact, if you so choose, I would be willing to ask your assistance in a task of great import.

We'll see what comes of this, then..msgid: We'll see what comes of this, then.

[ATTACK] I cannot accept this. We may h.msgid: [ATTACK] I cannot accept this.  We may have been allies on occasion, but we were enemies as well.  This time, I will not allow you to bring any further disruption to this world.

Hmmph. Still exterminating that which y.msgid: Hmmph.  Still exterminating that which you do not understand.  I know of your kind, Hunter.  Though I have long-abandoned my study of the arcane, I still remember all the damage your order did.

And this is not the time for more bloods.msgid: And this is not the time for more bloodshed.  You aren't some common arcanist, that much is clear.

We were founded in defense against the S.msgid: We were founded in defense against the Sanguine Order.  What damage we have caused, a bunch of murderous, cannibalistic madmen have done infinitely worse.

[ATTACK] I understand perfectly well. I.msgid: [ATTACK] I understand perfectly well.  I can see through your deceptions, and see that your "long-abandoned" studies are still ongoing.  I won't allow you any further chance to deceive me.

I see. I apologize then. All I have se.msgid: I see.  I apologize then.  All I have seen, it's hard not to be wary.  Well young one, if you will tolerate an old Keeper and his ramblings, perhaps you can help with something.

I have little love left for the Sanguine.msgid: I have little love left for the Sanguine Order either, but such excuses do not justify all that your brethren have done.  If you seek to keep dangerous magic out of the wrong hands, I can help you with such a thing, but you won't find what you seek through senseless violence.

If you insist. Tell me what you have to.msgid: If you insist.  Tell me what you have to offer, and we'll see where to go from there.

[ATTACK] I can figure it out myself. I.msgid: [ATTACK] I can figure it out myself.  I will not trust you to lead me further astray, Keeper.

Hmm. The nature of a blood mage, I susp.msgid: Hmm.  The nature of a blood mage, I suspect.  Sounds about right.  Even if you will not serve He From Beyond The Veil, there are insights to find your own use for.  And if you accept it, I have a task that will benefit us both.

I see. I can tell in your eyes young on.msgid: I see.  I can tell in your eyes young one, and sense it in my heart.  Another of our faithful.  If this is true, then you understand our shared mission.  I am sorry for deceiving you, but one can never be too cautious these days.  Come, we have much to discuss.

Esoteric studies and such, much of it th.msgid: Esoteric studies and such, much of it the ramblings of madmen in a world gone mad.  Every so often some glimmer of insight shines through however, and it is at least interesting to study.

Perhaps you could teach me some of that.msgid: Perhaps you could teach me some of that insight?

We shall see, another time perhaps. I h.msgid: We shall see, another time perhaps.  I have learned scattered handfuls of strange things, and maybe in time it will prove useful to another.

I'm glad to hear that there is still val.msgid: I'm glad to hear that there is still value in books, even in these dark times.  You may borrow from the shelves as you please, what little I have accumulated.

A strange question. Why do you seek suc.msgid: A strange question.  Why do you seek such a thing, and why from me?

I felt an instinctive pull. That of the.msgid: I felt an instinctive pull.  That of the Shrouded King, perhaps.

I have seen what the arcane can lead to..msgid: I have seen what the arcane can lead to.  Great things, but also great danger.

Your aura is alight with hidden magic an.msgid: Your aura is alight with hidden magic and concealed artifacts, I can see it through my mask.

You seem like you might have experience.msgid: You seem like you might have experience in such things.

Shrouded… few would speak of such things.msgid: Shrouded… few would speak of such things, not without cause.  Perhaps He has guided two wayward followers together to serve His will.  If you truly are faithful to He From Beyond The Veil, then we will have much to discuss.  There may in fact be something you can do to help…

I see. Perhaps then I can trust you wit.msgid: I see.  Perhaps then I can trust you with this.  You are correct in that I have some familiarity with the arcane, limited though it may be.  I am not sure if I have anything useful to teach you, if that is what you seek.

You have a keen eye, and a wit beyond yo.msgid: You have a keen eye, and a wit beyond your years.  This is true, I have studied in the arcane arts.  Far more than that, I have been a scholar of them for quite some time.  I do not yet know what I can trust you with, but we shall see.

I should've suspected as such. It has b.msgid: I should've suspected as such.  It has been so long since I have seen one of those masks.  But do you wear it with purpose?

I do. I am not your enemy, Keeper. Tha.msgid: I do.  I am not your enemy, Keeper.  That is what you are, correct?

[ATTACK] My purpose is to finish what my.msgid: [ATTACK] My purpose is to finish what my brethren started, and destroy threats to humanity.  For your worship of a monster from Beyond, and for the wounds in The Veil your order has inflicted, I sentence you to death.

I'm not one of the mage hunters actually.msgid: I'm not one of the mage hunters actually, but I've learned the usefulness of these items.

I see. Well, the truth is laid bare for.msgid: I see.  Well, the truth is laid bare for you it seems, the nature of my studies.  If you wish, I will answer your questions.  And I may have something for you to do.

You are correct. I wish our orders had.msgid: You are correct.  I wish our orders had seen the common ground we share, rather than letting our differences lead to so much bloodshed.  It seems we have much to catch up on, and a task may suit both of our goals.

You are mistaken, I'm afraid. Whatever.msgid: You are mistaken, I'm afraid.  Whatever it is you seek, I can't help you with such strange requests.

You've already recently pressed that pec.msgid: You've already recently pressed that peculiar demand of yours.  I ask that you don't speak of it again for now.

That is true. I used to be a devout sor.msgid: That is true.  I used to be a devout sort back in the old days.  I feel as though I have lost my way, but you needn't worry over it.  I still have faith, though I feel that this self-imposed hermitage is all someone like me can manage.

You're right, I suppose. It's good to s.msgid: You're right, I suppose.  It's good to see that I'm not the only one the consider the value of the writen word.  Especially when so much knowledge has surely died with those that have fallen…

You'd be surprised what you can learn wi.msgid: You'd be surprised what you can learn with a bit of reading.  Like manners…

In truth, I am in self-imposed exile. A.msgid: In truth, I am in self-imposed exile.  After so many of my fellows have been hunted down, or else slaughtered by various terrible things, I have nothing left to do with my life, nor the oath I have sworn.

Meditation, keeping myself busy with wha.msgid: Meditation, keeping myself busy with what I've learned, that sort of thing.  Little of value in such trying times, unfortunately.

We will still prevail. Do not lose hope.msgid: We will still prevail.  Do not lose hope just yet.

There is always value in such knowledge..msgid: There is always value in such knowledge.  Surely there is something you can teach?

You seem to be hiding something. Or fro.msgid: You seem to be hiding something.  Or from someone.  It's okay, you can trust me.

Is that all you do out here?.msgid: Is that all you do out here?

There was a calamity that broke the back.msgid: There was a calamity that broke the back of our order.  Only a few survived and fled, and from them I heard horror stories about our sanctum alight with rifts, the high priest seized by some abomination from a failed summoning…

A calamity… it was our doing, wasn't it?.msgid: A calamity… it was our doing, wasn't it?

Despite our differences, this sounds lik.msgid: Despite our differences, this sounds like a threat to us both.

Indeed. Your brethren sabotaged the rel.msgid: Indeed.  Your brethren sabotaged the relic retrieved for us, and it led to summoning something… else, instead of our intended communion with He From Beyond The Veil.

I appreciate your sentiment, but while w.msgid: I appreciate your sentiment, but while we must all acknowledge when our brethren have erred, you had no hand in this.  Perhaps these wrongs can be righted in time.  Thank you.

You may deny your responsibility just be.msgid: You may deny your responsibility just because you had no personal involvement, but we must be willing to accept when our fellows have sinned or been led astray.  Perhaps your precious "Path to Power" will lead you to do something productive.

Indeed it is. This monster, which they.msgid: Indeed it is.  This monster, which they named The Archon, might further endanger us all if it can gain a foothold in this world, and we have enough threats to humanity as it is.

They called it The Archon. Another powe.msgid: They called it The Archon.  Another powerful presence from Beyond, but what its truly is or what it desires I have no idea.  Only that its actions make it clear that it is far less benevolent than our master.

Offer no intrusion upon their domain, an.msgid: Offer no intrusion upon their domain, and do not willfully consort with their power…

One of your tenets, hunter. I am aware..msgid: One of your tenets, hunter.  I am aware.  Though we disagree on the nature of He From Beyond The Veil and his intent, caution is always healthy so long as it is tempered by an open mind.

It seems there is still cause for hope..msgid: It seems there is still cause for hope.  I may be too old to further His will, but there will always be another.  And I see that potential in you.  Thank you.

Perhaps that is correct. What do you se.msgid: Perhaps that is correct.  What do you seek this knowledge for?

To teach the next generation what is pro.msgid: To teach the next generation what is proper and safe.

Knowledge is dangerous if in the wrong h.msgid: Knowledge is dangerous if in the wrong hands.

Knowledge is power, but it is wasted unl.msgid: Knowledge is power, but it is wasted unless passed on.

To hoard knowledge is foolish. Your tri.msgid: To hoard knowledge is foolish.  Your trivial learning is likely to die with you.

To gaze into the Beyond is to see the po.msgid: To gaze into the Beyond is to see the potential of a thousand worlds, and learn hidden truths…

I am eager to learn, if you would have m.msgid: I am eager to learn, if you would have me as a student.

That is a wise method of practicing caut.msgid: That is a wise method of practicing caution.  For the benefit of those who will succeed us.  If you wish it then, I have more than trivial things to teach you.  We were allies on occasion, enemies on others.  Forgive the deception of this aging follower of He From Beyond The Veil, and allow us the chance to work together to correct the mistakes of old.

Very well then. What I can do to help?.msgid: Very well then.  What I can do to help?

So be it. We need not be enemies..msgid: So be it.  We need not be enemies.

[ATTACK] So that is your true nature. I.msgid: [ATTACK] So that is your true nature.  I won't stoop to working with a profligate like you.

Always the practical type. But I can ap.msgid: Always the practical type.  But I can appreciate the drive to put knowledge to good use, rather than be squandered.  As you wish.  I can tell from your demeanor that you are of the Sanguine Order.  And I, of the Keepers of The Oath.  Perhaps He From Beyond The Veil will grant us both penance.

Then tell me what I must do..msgid: Then tell me what I must do.

[ATTACK] I need no penance from your so-.msgid: [ATTACK] I need no penance from your so-called god.  I would rather your knowledge die with you than deal with the likes of him.

…but be cautious in these acts. Let eve.msgid: …but be cautious in these acts.  Let every wound in The Veil be a necessary one, or else leave no mark.  We are kin, it seems.  He From Beyond The Veil has granted us a second chance, it seems.

Tell me what I can do to serve Him..msgid: Tell me what I can do to serve Him.

Very well then. Perhaps I have somethin.msgid: Very well then.  Perhaps I have something to teach after all.  I was a follower of an order of scholars and priests, serving a benevolent deity from Beyond.  If you wish it, we will see what can be done.

If that is your reasoning, then you are.msgid: If that is your reasoning, then you are not yet ready.

Very well then. I have studied a few hi.msgid: Very well then.  I have studied a few hints of the arcane in my time, little though it might be, and given the danger it can lead to if misused, I have chosen to live a humble life rather than further pursue such things.

A strange thing to ask an old man in the.msgid: A strange thing to ask an old man in these troublesome times.  Nothing more than the usual task of surviving out here.

You already pried about personal matters.msgid: You already pried about personal matters quite recently.  Please, it's fine.

There are many secrets that He From Beyo.msgid: There are many secrets that He From Beyond The Veil will reward you with, if you make proper use of His relic.  I do know a few tricks from my youth that may compliment the tools He will give you, however.  I can pass onto you the Magic Signs of Free Action, Phase Shield, or Transcendent Aura.  I ask that you bring crystallized essence in exchange, as I can use it for these rituals and for other wards I maintain here.

What can you tell me about Free Action?.msgid: What can you tell me about Free Action?

What can you tell me about Phase Shield?.msgid: What can you tell me about Phase Shield?

What can you tell me about Transcendent.msgid: What can you tell me about Transcendent Aura?

I already know all of these. Thanks any.msgid: I already know all of these.  Thanks anyway.

Though both it and Surging Force can hal.msgid: Though both it and Surging Force can halt time briefly, the main purpose of Free Action is in traversing rough terrain, slipping out of a monster's grasp, or negating other hazards that might slow you down.  I use it to traverse the woods when gathering firewood or hunting, I'm not as light on my feet as I used to be.  If you bring me 1 crystallized essence, I can imprint this knowledge upon you.

I'll need to obtain one. Maybe later..msgid: I'll need to obtain one.  Maybe later.

It's a warding spell that lashes out aga.msgid: It's a warding spell that lashes out against those who strike you, similar to the more well-known Shadowy Shield.  Rather than harming your attacker directly, it shunts them a short distance away from you.  It does the same to any other threats close enough, when it activates.  If you bring me 1 crystallized essence, I can imprint this knowledge upon you.

This secret has been passed down among a.msgid: This secret has been passed down among a few of the more learned ascetics of my order.  It shrouds your aura against monsters from Beyond, blinding them to your presence.  It doesn't hide you from the undead I've found, earthly life in general seems to spot you more easily under its effect, but it has its uses.  If you bring me 1 crystallized essence, I can imprint this knowledge upon you.

There is nothing I have urgent need of,.msgid: There is nothing I have urgent need of, beyond what I can manage myself.  Thank you for your concern however, young one.

Thank you once again for your help here..msgid: Thank you once again for your help here.

Cause no trouble, and you will be welcom.msgid: Cause no trouble, and you will be welcome here.

[MISSION] Johnathan said I should ask on.msgid: [MISSION] Johnathan said I should ask one of you for help?

[MISSION] Sofia said I should ask one of.msgid: [MISSION] Sofia said I should ask one of you for help?

I'm not here to cause trouble. Why such.msgid: I'm not here to cause trouble.  Why such hostility?

I'm not here to fight you, hunter..msgid: I'm not here to fight you, hunter.

Take your attitude and shove it, mage hu.msgid: Take your attitude and shove it, mage hunter.

I see. You know full well how dangerous.msgid: I see.  You know full well how dangerous these sanguinists can be, be on your guard.

I see. I hope you are prepared for this.msgid: I see.  I hope you are prepared for this, be on your guard.

May the blood mages find justice, under.msgid: May the blood mages find justice, under the hammer of the gods.

May we find peace, through bringing ligh.msgid: May we find peace, through bringing light into unholy darkness.

I have nothing for you, sadly..msgid: I have nothing for you, sadly.

You know what, you can go fuck yourself..msgid: You know what, you can go fuck yourself.

And do you still uphold the faith?.msgid: And do you still uphold the faith?

I'm not one of them, I can assure you..msgid: I'm not one of them, I can assure you.

I have been chosen by He From Beyond The.msgid: I have been chosen by He From Beyond The Veil.

I was a student of an arcanist, trained.msgid: I was a student of an arcanist, trained in the art of summoning.

I don't need to explain anything to you..msgid: I don't need to explain anything to you.

If I have anything of that sort, would y.msgid: If I have anything of that sort, would you accept it?

I see. I'll speak with her then..msgid: I see.  I'll speak with her then.

It's fine. I should speak to Sofia abou.msgid: It's fine.  I should speak to Sofia about it.

[ATTACK] If that's the way you're going.msgid: [ATTACK] If that's the way you're going to be, then I'll send you and your misbegotten kin to meet your so-called gods.

The prevailing theory at first was that.msgid: The prevailing theory at first was that the Sanguine Order or Keepers of The Oath were to blame somehow, but many of us started to doubt that.  Especially with the reports coming in from the Purifiers, our contacts who dealt more closely with civilization.

I was with a few others. We were travel.msgid: I was with a few others.  We were traveling to a planned rendezvous point to meet another hunting party, one of us had a cell phone.  Couldn't get any reception, I thought maybe it was because we were in a fairly rural area.  Right as we were arguing over why we might not be getting any signal, one of the others yells out for a mask check.

Put our masks on and activate them. We.msgid: Put our masks on and activate them.  We normally periodically look around through our masks while on the move anyway, to avoid being caught off guard.

We were all nearly struck blind. In nea.msgid: We were all nearly struck blind.  In nearly every direction, horrible light flooded in from beyond the normal limit of our masks' perception range.  Only very powerful effects can be seem from that far away through clairvoyance, and whatever caused all this could be perceived for miles away, in every single direction.

I was blindsided by it like the rest. W.msgid: I was blindsided by it like the rest.  When I saw what had happened to the cities, I knew all our suspicions of worrying phenomena paled in comparison.

A war. That's the only thing that comes.msgid: A war.  That's the only thing that comes to mind.  There were signs of more than just the usual collateral damage.  Maybe WWIII just barely started happening, and the nuclear blasts weakened The Veil further.  Large enough spikes of energy can interact with anomalies, so it's possible at least.  Not like we can test it, though.

The rest of my hunting party had been pi.msgid: The rest of my hunting party had been picked off over the past week or so.  I didn't know where else to go, but I knew there was a town not far from where I was, and possible contacts on the outskirts.

I'm guessing the town was overrun..msgid: I'm guessing the town was overrun.

Yeah. When I saw that, I knew. Whateve.msgid: Yeah.  When I saw that, I knew.  Whatever caused this was bigger than our conflict with the Sanguine Order.  Bigger than the Keepers of The Oath, bigger than every conflict we were involved in.  Something loosed the gates of Hell itself and it consumed everything in sight…

There was a growing instability in The V.msgid: There was a growing instability in The Veil, and that's what caused these horrors to come spilling out into our world.  Whatever it was, it did more damage than the sanguinists and keepers combined.  Everything before, though…

What about the stuff that happened befor.msgid: What about the stuff that happened beforehand?

To be honest, I'm not convinced that the.msgid: To be honest, I'm not convinced that the rioting and pollution are related to that.  Most of the others suspect the undead might be connected to the latter, but I'm not sure of that either.  My personal hot take on this is that it was a perfect storm of disasters, all of which made the anomalies themselves not only worse, but made it harder to prevent.

What'd you find when you arrived?.msgid: What'd you find when you arrived?

I can't tell you anything useful. The p.msgid: I can't tell you anything useful.  The people I was with spent a good solid month or two prior to the Apocalypse on a mission.  We ended up getting tunnel vision, I guess you could say…

I was trailing reports of suspected sang.msgid: I was trailing reports of suspected sanguine activity with the rest of my hunting party.  Didn't end well, obviously.

We were wrong. Dead wrong. We found a.msgid: We were wrong.  Dead wrong.  We found a bunch of bodies hastily shoveled into a mass grave, but no ritual activity.  There was an Army vehicle actually, gods know what sort of strange shit they were up to.  We would've been scrambling to break contact and avoid bringing unwanted attention to our order, but any soldiers were long gone by then.

So you had some sort of masquerade thing.msgid: So you had some sort of masquerade thing going?

It's not like we were that large a group.msgid: It's not like we were that large a group, and we had a few contacts who had a vested interest in keeping us out of trouble.  No doubt they were already aware we existed, but likely saw us as just a small band of vigilantes at most.  Which was practically what we were in the old days anyway.

The dead didn't stay that way. In fact.msgid: The dead didn't stay that way.  In fact our arrival stirred most of the corpses up.  Dozens of them, writhing and scrabbling over each other to crawl out of a trench barely 10 feet long and only a few feet deep.  Lost two of us before we were forced to break contact rather than try to put the poor things down.  We'd find out later on just how much worse it was everywhere else.

For what purpose do you aid these interl.msgid: For what purpose do you aid these interlopers?

I do not know what you mean. We seek ha.msgid: I do not know what you mean.  We seek harmony, and greater understanding of the world.  We have found peace here.

You are dangerously ignorant of the thre.msgid: You are dangerously ignorant of the threat this place presents, and their intent.

These things do not belong in this world.msgid: These things do not belong in this world.

\"Any otherworldly monster must be retur.msgid: "Any otherworldly monster must be returned to its true domain, living or dead."  That is my duty.  Do not interfere.

These things are an infection that must.msgid: These things are an infection that must be cured.

Then enjoy your peace while it lasts. I.msgid: Then enjoy your peace while it lasts.  I've nothing more to say to you.

This place is our shelter and nourishmen.msgid: This place is our shelter and nourishment, our calm in the storm.  But what of your intent?  I am a simple priest, and I wish no harm upon you.

[ATTACK] You are their slave. My master.msgid: [ATTACK] You are their slave.  My master wills that I free you through death.

In time, you will see the betrayal these.msgid: In time, you will see the betrayal these things inflict.  Remember that I gave you fair warning.

If they are truly of another world, then.msgid: If they are truly of another world, then this is a blessing.  One only needs to have an open mind and heart.

[ATTACK] Enough. May He forge your chai.msgid: [ATTACK] Enough.  May He forge your chains.

And you need to open your eyes. I will.msgid: And you need to open your eyes.  I will let you live, so that one day you will see the truth.

\"All things are of nature, born from th.msgid: "All things are of nature, born from the mother who shines upon both finite and infinite."  Would you truly wish harm upon the blessing we have been given?

[ATTACK] You will burn with them all the.msgid: [ATTACK] You will burn with them all the same, profligate.

My quarrel is not with you. I hope that.msgid: My quarrel is not with you.  I hope that you will learn the true danger that lurks here.

This is a blessing, not an infection. I.msgid: This is a blessing, not an infection.  In such troubled times, we give thanks for the blessing that shelters us.

[ATTACK] It is clearly already too late.msgid: [ATTACK] It is clearly already too late for you, then.  Die.

Then I will leave you to your delusions..msgid: Then I will leave you to your delusions.

Welcome, Marshal. What can I do for you.msgid: Welcome, Marshal.  What can I do for you?

Welcome, what can I do for you?.msgid: Welcome, what can I do for you?

Howdy, what can I get for you?.msgid: Howdy, what can I get for you?

So, how are you getting along with the o.msgid: So, how are you getting along with the others here?

What do you do around here?.msgid: What do you do around here?

I'd like to ask about turning in a bount.msgid: I'd like to ask about turning in a bounty.

Can I do anything to help?.msgid: Can I do anything to help?

Something just like what your boys are l.msgid: Something just like what your boys are looking for recently spooked some gamer we were tracking, earlier today.  I didn't pay it no mind when it it happened, but that was a damn fool mistake o' mine to not bring it up sooner.  Y'all are takin' this seriously, here's what we know of the encounter and where it happened along our game trails.  Keep an eye on things and pass it on t' the Grandmaster, will ya?

Ran across what looked a skirmish during.msgid: Ran across what looked a skirmish during a recent patrol.  Mess o' bandits put down by something, probably the night before we found the bodies.  Had time to pick the poor bastards clean of supplies an' gear, whatever did that to 'em wasn't a shambler nor a gunfight.  I'll pass word up the chain of command for ya.  Try not gt' et killed chasin' what did that.

Traveling merchant stopped by a couple d.msgid: Traveling merchant stopped by a couple days ago, we had a chat and exchanged a few goods.  He mentioned going the long way around some old neck of the woods on the way over here, said he saw movement in the shadows, and with what's going on recently that sounds exactly like what the Grandmaster's looking for.  I didn't think anything of it the other day, I'll pass word on to Johnathan for you.  Keep up the good work.

Strange folk, but I don't mind. They're.msgid: Strange folk, but I don't mind.  They're friendly at least, and know the area fairly well.  Makes hunting in the area a lot less stressful.

They've got fight in 'em, I can tell tha.msgid: They've got fight in 'em, I can tell that much.  Not the mercenary type or like raiders either, more like the crusadin' type.  Better at drinkin' than I figured them to be, at least.

They have my men working fairly hard to.msgid: They have my men working fairly hard to keep the place in good working order, that's for sure.  But they work pretty damn hard right along with us.  Odd choice of equipment on them I suppose, but it seems to do well enough.

Just a local hunter. Outdoors experienc.msgid: Just a local hunter.  Outdoors experience came in handy when it all went to shit, so I guess there's that.

Used to be a soldier, 'bout a decade ago.msgid: Used to be a soldier, 'bout a decade ago.  Rest of my boys probably would've turned raider if I hadn't been around to knock some sense into 'em.  Now we make a living cleaning up the mess the guys still in service weren't able to unfuck.

These days, just a scavenger I guess. D.msgid: These days, just a scavenger I guess.  Don't have any family left that I know of, so not like my old life doing odd jobs matters much.  Rather not talk about it.

I arrange hunts and scavenging runs main.msgid: I arrange hunts and scavenging runs mainly, along with keeping the other folks sent here running around, staying busy.  If you need something, I can offer you a good deal from our cut of the hunt.

Mostly help run extra security for the p.msgid: Mostly help run extra security for the patrols, though these guys don't really need much help with that.  Shoot monsters, get ammo out of the deal, use that to shoot more monsters… cycle of life ain't it?  Or the cycle of death.  Can sell you some if ya want.

Mostly just help out around, organize th.msgid: Mostly just help out around, organize the scavenging runs and manage trade.  Lot of stuff we bring in either goes to the locals or back to the center, but I can make do.

Far as steady jobs go, not much. I got.msgid: Far as steady jobs go, not much.  I got bounties on behalf of the people running this place, however.  Not like shooting people in the face kinda bounties, more monster-hunting and other stuff like that.  Interested?

What sort of bounties are on offer?.msgid: What sort of bounties are on offer?

That \"Grandmaster\" guy had me look int.msgid: That "Grandmaster" guy had me look into running two different kinds of bounty to offer.  First off, if you have any of those weird pieces certain critters drop, I can arrange for a payment of a Scale each.  Twisted bones, amorphous amber, that sort of thing.  Second, they have a bounty on certain books.  Eldritch lore kinda stuff.

What books are they asking for?.msgid: What books are they asking for?

Maybe later, I have something else to as.msgid: Maybe later, I have something else to ask about.

Here you go, then. One Golden Scale, an.msgid: Here you go, then.  One Golden Scale, and I'll have this sent to the boss.  Anything else?

I'd like to ask about another bounty..msgid: I'd like to ask about another bounty.

Only got a couple on their wishlist, pay.msgid: Only got a couple on their wishlist, paying out a good sum for each one.  One's called Sanguine Codex, another's Oaths to The Chalice, and then there's To Master The Unknown.  What do ya got?

Sanguine Codex? They just want to have.msgid: Sanguine Codex?  They just want to have it burnt, don't they?

For what purpose are they after Oaths to.msgid: For what purpose are they after Oaths to The Chalice?

I can hand over a copy of Sanguine Codex.msgid: I can hand over a copy of Sanguine Codex.

I can hand over a copy of Oaths to The C.msgid: I can hand over a copy of Oaths to The Chalice.

I can hand over a copy of To Master The.msgid: I can hand over a copy of To Master The Unknown.

Nevermind, that should be all for now..msgid: Nevermind, that should be all for now.

I have no idea. That Johnathan boy seem.msgid: I have no idea.  That Johnathan boy seemed the book-burning type, but when we arranged the deal the other lady was keeping a close eye on him.  Had me promise to hand 'em over to someone else she was workin' with, instead of him.  We have a deal or not?

Alright, fine. I have one here..msgid: Alright, fine.  I have one here.

No thanks, that's all for now I guess..msgid: No thanks, that's all for now I guess.

Hell if I know. Some kind cult book, th.msgid: Hell if I know.  Some kind cult book, that Ms. McKinnon lady was making sure I'd turn them in to someone working for her instead of the Grandmaster.  Guessin' she doesn't trust him not to go burning them.

Very well then. I'll trust you to handl.msgid: Very well then.  I'll trust you to handle this with care.

Pleasure doin' business with ya, I'll be.msgid: Pleasure doin' business with ya, I'll be careful about getting this sent over to Sofia.  Anything else?

[MISSION] The captain said you might be.msgid: [MISSION] The captain said you might be able to help get some information on local laboratories that might have been handling anomalous materials.

From my understanding, a few research ma.msgid: From my understanding, a few research materials passed through this site during construction and there was some communication with military and research facilities in the area.  I don't know if it'll help, what are you trying to find in particular?

I'm looking for information on something.msgid: I'm looking for information on something called Project Kairos.

Let me check the database here. There a.msgid: Let me check the database here.  There are some records of it showing up, more recently I've also heard it come up intermittently on civilian chatter.  Is that your doing?

The people who sent me to find it might.msgid: The people who sent me to find it might have been asking around.

I'm not sure. What were you able to fin.msgid: I'm not sure.  What were you able to find out?

They gave me this list of information th.msgid: They gave me this list of information they gathered, is this any help?

I see. I've heard some very strange shi.msgid: I see.  I've heard some very strange shit coming over the refugee communications.  But if you trust whoever is looking into this Marshal, then I'll see what I can do.  I think I found something.

You mentioned anomalous materials, well.msgid: You mentioned anomalous materials, well a few shipments under that description passed through her as well as afew other sites.  The name came up on one facility's shipment list and sure enough, almost half the anomalous materials this computer has records on went to a single location.  Let me print out the shipment info for you.

Alright, here you go. Be careful with t.msgid: Alright, here you go.  Be careful with this, though.  This is a lot of sensitive information, not to mention dangerous.  These Priority Sites will only get more hazardous as time goes on and more things break down.  I'll trust you to use your discretion.

Where the hell did you get all this? Th.msgid: Where the hell did you get all this?  This lists several classified sites, movement between them… god damn, it even lists coordinates for this place!  Who'd you get this from?

I can vouch for the people who found thi.msgid: I can vouch for the people who found this information, we were tracking very dangerous threats to humanity.

An organization that had been monitoring.msgid: An organization that had been monitoring anomalous activity.

A local researcher trying to fix this me.msgid: A local researcher trying to fix this mess.

And to think I knew what to expect out o.msgid: And to think I knew what to expect out of you, Marshal.  This is insane.  These people made a mockery of national security.  But I guess they didn't get that far, if you still need our help.  Alright, to hell with it.  If you let me keep that list of info I'll give you the shipment information in return.  Then I'm going to need get a stiff drink next time I'm off duty.

I need to think about it..msgid: I need to think about it.

Well they've done a much better job moni.msgid: Well they've done a much better job monitoring this sort of thing than I'd expect.  I sure hope you know what you're doing Marshal, working with these people.  I'll get you that information, but I'm going to have to ask you to give me these intel documents in exchange.  We need to make sure no other organizations might have gotten their hands on similar information.

There's no way just one researcher, even.msgid: There's no way just one researcher, even if they were an insider, could've gather all this information.  Who are you working for, Marshal?

A local settlement that has attracted a.msgid: A local settlement that has attracted a small number of researchers, attempting to figure out what caused all this.

An arcanist order calling themselves The.msgid: An arcanist order calling themselves The Cleansing Flame.

I see. I don't know how they organized.msgid: I see.  I don't know how they organized an intel leak like this or how much insider knowledge it took to get this far, but I'll admit that's impressive.  Look, you want this info I'll trade you for those papers.  I'm willing to give your group the benefit of the doubt here, but I'd like to be able to analyze these leaks just to make sure nothing bad comes of it.  Deal?

An arcane what? I need to look this up..msgid: An arcane what?  I need to look this up.  Religious shit, scattered police chatter over the years, small-scale vigilante stuff.  Old records that suggest something federal authorities were keeping an eye on but didn't see as much of a threat.  I don't even remotely know what to make of this.  I guess the world was going crazy for longer than I thought it was.

I can vouch for their intentions. We we.msgid: I can vouch for their intentions.  We were aware of anomalous threats developing for some time, but we never came close to figuring out what was causing it.  Now we have a chance to correct that.

You wouldn't be the first to underestima.msgid: You wouldn't be the first to underestimate them.  Their numbers were small and their reach slight, but they knew something was going wrong well before the world ended.  They just didn't know where to look.

They had their reasons for acting as the.msgid: They had their reasons for acting as they do.  They do not know the truth of what has ruined this world, but they did what they could.  This is an opportunity to gain valuable insight into how things could be set right.

All I know for certain is that they're t.msgid: All I know for certain is that they're trying to find possible countermeasures for what's caused all this, or at least something that might help make things better.  They believe this research project might hold the key to that.

With the current shape this facility is.msgid: With the current shape this facility is in, I'm not sure if we have any data on local laboratories accessible to us.  I am aware that some research materials may have passed through this site in limited quantities while the lower levels were still under construction.  I would first like to ask why you need this information, Marshal.

There's a local researcher who's looking.msgid: There's a local researcher who's looking into anomalous materials projects in the hope of potentially improving things.

I was sent to try and get enough informa.msgid: I was sent to try and get enough information to locate a research facility tied to something called Project Kairos.

I don't know how this could improve thin.msgid: I don't know how this could improve things, but I'll see what I can do.  If you can get in touch with our comms team, speak with them and they might be able to find something.

Alright, I'll see what I can do..msgid: Alright, I'll see what I can do.

I have no idea what that is, but alright.msgid: I have no idea what that is, but alright.  There might be something related to that in the communications records, or at least something that will help you figure it out.  If you can reach our communications team, ask them about it.

Then I can't help you if you're not goin.msgid: Then I can't help you if you're not going to explain yourself, Marshal.  We have important work to be done here.

[MISSION] Would the Old Guard be willing.msgid: [MISSION] Would the Old Guard be willing to establish a presence in another community?

I have received a number of reports abou.msgid: I have received a number of reports about attacks, I assume you are tracking the cause on someone else's behalf?  I would like to help, but we are stretched thin as it is.  I've only had enough manpower to follow up on one of the most recent assaults on our patrols, and it certainly fits the bill for "anomalous" as you put it.  I'll send off the debriefing summary, but I doubt that will be enough to help.  There is a lot going on lately, keep asking around and maybe you can do something with all that intel.

Okay. I guess I'll report back to them,.msgid: Okay.  I guess I'll report back to them, then.

It's a group converting a rural church i.msgid: It's a group converting a rural church into a small outpost, who have been trading with the Free Merchants.

I'll look into other options, just in ca.msgid: I'll look into other options, just in case.  Thank you though.

I've heard rumors about that, from peopl.msgid: I've heard rumors about that, from people bringing in news of the outside world.  Lot of mixed messages and misinformation though.  Whatever they're up to, at least a couple people higher up the chain of command might have an interest in keeping an eye on them, but I'm not sure how well that'll turn out.  What can you tell me about them?

I've been a part of their group since be.msgid: I've been a part of their group since before things boiled over.  We were focused on hunting down and dealing with some of the anomalies that began to show up in the months leading up to this.

I'm one of then, actually. We have a co.msgid: I'm one of then, actually.  We have a common interest, doing our best to ensure humanity's survival.  We have our ways, rooted in the otherworldly though they are.

They're hunters. Monster hunters these.msgid: They're hunters.  Monster hunters these days, in the past they fought with local occult groups and other small-scale threats, before it all boiled over.

Monster hunters, primarily. Decently eq.msgid: Monster hunters, primarily.  Decently equipped for their size, if a bit eccentric.

So you can vouch for them, Marshal. Tha.msgid: So you can vouch for them, Marshal.  That's good.  I hope you know the risks.  If even half the rumors brought back by survivors that meet with them are true, they're involved in some odd business, and that might attract the wrong kind of attention from top brass.  If you're sure, I'll do what I can to put in word with my superiors to make contact with them and set up a contact.

I don't think either party can afford no.msgid: I don't think either party can afford not to work together for survival.  Go ahead.

Perhaps you're right. I'll look into al.msgid: Perhaps you're right.  I'll look into alternatives as well, just in case.  Thank you, however.

So be it, Marshal. I'll be in contact w.msgid: So be it, Marshal.  I'll be in contact with the local merchant too since I know they have prior arrangements.  If all goes well, they should be set up by the time you return.  Just hope this pans out…

Thank you. There's something else I wan.msgid: Thank you.  There's something else I wanted to talk about, before I leave.

Thank you. I should go check on them, g.msgid: Thank you.  I should go check on them, goodbye for now.

Otherworldly stuff, huh. I've seen and.msgid: Otherworldly stuff, huh.  I've seen and heard a lot of strange things, but that's not something I want to get involved with.  If there's any truth to this, then maybe you have a point.  Still, be careful getting involved in this.  I'll put in my recommendation if you're sure this is the best course of action, Marshal.

We must ally with outsiders to survive,.msgid: We must ally with outsiders to survive, and our experience will be to their benefit.  Go for it.

I'll look into alternatives then. Thank.msgid: I'll look into alternatives then.  Thank you though.

Great. Occult stuff and vigilantism. I.msgid: Great.  Occult stuff and vigilantism.  If you know that much about them, and still think they'll get along with the Old Guard, then I'll trust your judgment.  Just say the word, and I'll do what I can to smooth things over.

On second thought, I'll seek out another.msgid: On second thought, I'll seek out another option.

I've heard stranger rumors than that, so.msgid: I've heard stranger rumors than that, so I suppose if that's what they are at heart, then it's in our best interest to work together.  I still have my reservations about this, but if you're sure, I can get in touch with my superiors and try to win them over.

Just gotta keep pushing your luck, huh?.msgid: Just gotta keep pushing your luck, huh?  Well alright, if that's all you're after, I don't like dealing in rumors but this sounds like serious shit.  You hear stupid stories from drunk survivors all the time, only one I'd put stock in comes from one of the more experienced fellows, who said she had a run-in with a ghost or some shit. Out by the river.  Had a freezer burn on the back of her hand, couple hairline fractures too.  If she wasn't stone-cold sober, and one of the few scavengers I can trust not to bullshit me, I wouldn't have given her story a second thought.

[MISSION] I've been asked to help attrac.msgid: [MISSION] I've been asked to help attract work for another community of survivors.  Know anyone who could help?

One of the traders stopped by telling st.msgid: One of the traders stopped by telling stories like that, mentioned an old town a few days travel down the road.  He said not to travel through the outer edges of the residential section at night, mentioned some strange goings-on there.  Personally I don't believe it's anything more than the usual freaks, but he was convinced it was something else.  Hope that's what you're looking for.

We're already struggling to make up for.msgid: We're already struggling to make up for demand as it is.  Lots of people coming in and not enough food to go around.

They're mainly interested in trade and l.msgid: They're mainly interested in trade and labor, actually.

They can take care of themselves, if you.msgid: They can take care of themselves, if you think you can work something out?

Well, if they can think of something and.msgid: Well, if they can think of something and are willing to provide a stable supply of food in exchange, I guess that works.  Labor is about all we have, and even then I'm reluctant to commit any people to an unknown settlement.

Having another contact with other surviv.msgid: Having another contact with other survivors is useful too.

I suppose you have a point there. New p.msgid: I suppose you have a point there.  New people come in every so often, giving them details on another place to go must ease a bit of burden here.  I'll see what I can do, what can you tell me about them?

A local settlement in a fortified roadsi.msgid: A local settlement in a fortified roadside church.  It's not too far from the refugee center.

Alright. I'll have someone set up and s.msgid: Alright.  I'll have someone set up and see if they can finalize this deal with the people that run the place.  Here's hoping it goes well…

Thank you. I should go check on them..msgid: Thank you.  I should go check on them.

Well good. I dunno what they could be a.msgid: Well good.  I dunno what they could be asking for in that case.  Supplies and labor, especially skilled labor, are still important here.

They seem more interested in having anot.msgid: They seem more interested in having another point of contact with other settlements.  Would be useful, right?

Don't have much contact with people who'.msgid: Don't have much contact with people who'd know about that sort of thing.  However, I did hear about a scavenger caravan the refugee center sent that hit some of the old labs.

Something interesting, evidently. Enoug.msgid: Something interesting, evidently.  Enough that they had to fight some bandits for it.  They struck camp sometime after that and never made it back onto the road.

I'll ask around for other leads..msgid: I'll ask around for other leads.

I suppose. But first I'm interested in.msgid: I suppose.  But first I'm interested in something myself.  What you need this for anyway?

I need more information on what was bein.msgid: I need more information on what was being shipped between the sites on this list.

There's a specific research facility I w.msgid: There's a specific research facility I was asked to try and find.

Well that is fascinating. You're doing.msgid: Well that is fascinating.  You're doing your homework on these locations, you could say.  I'd be interested too, we're always in need of supplies and this might give us another way to get them.  Whatever you're looking for in those shipments, if you're willing to share that info we can coordinate on this to avoid stepping on each other's toes.

Sure. Tell me what you know..msgid: Sure.  Tell me what you know.

I'll mark where they were last heard fro.msgid: I'll mark where they were last heard from.  Goes without saying, be careful out there.  I don't know for sure what sort of paperwork or maps or whatever they found, but they seemed excited enough and it sounded like whatever they had would've been the key to any future lab dives they had planned.  You come back here in one piece with that info and I'll do what I can to compensate you.

Some old refugee caravan that wasn't eve.msgid: Some old refugee caravan that wasn't even headed our way's nothing important, either.  Probably just got eaten by what passes for wildlife these days.  You change your mind and feel a bit more open to telling me what you're after, then maybe we can make a deal.

I see. I'll assume it's dangerous if it.msgid: I see.  I'll assume it's dangerous if it involved anomalous stuff as you described it.  I think we can make a deal here.  If you find whatever that caravan was so excited over and it leads you to what you're after, clue us in too if there's any other useful labs it can help scope out.  That way we'll know what to look for and where, so we won't be risking our lives over nothing.

I've heard rumors, and I know some peopl.msgid: I've heard rumors, and I know some people trying to make the journey here have had trouble of that sort.  I'll go ahead and relay to you the most recent bit of information I've overheard regarding that, send it off to whoever you're asking on behalf of.

Afraid I can't help you with that, we ha.msgid: Afraid I can't help you with that, we have enough on our plates as it is.  Once things are a bit more set up, I guess ask around, but I've got a lot of work to deal with myself.

Now that you mention it, yes. A few day.msgid: Now that you mention it, yes.  A few days ago one of the scavengers came in with a severe injury, described a strange creature that attacked him while on his way to rendezvous with a few others.  I can relay where it happened I guess.  Very odd too, a three-inch section of his forearm suffered from fourth-degree frostbite, down to the tendons, and both the radius and ulna had a complete transverse fracture in that area.  We had no choice but to amputate, I'm afraid…

One of my scouting parties saw movement.msgid: One of my scouting parties saw movement consistent with some of the strange creatures we've intermittently heard rumors about, the more recent attacks that have hit a few travelers in the area.  I'll send off the information on what happened and where, I guess.

Got a lot of work that needs to be done.msgid: Got a lot of work that needs to be done as it is, and supplies that need moving.  I might be able to work something out with them.

They're interested in trade contacts as.msgid: They're interested in trade contacts as well, so that might prove useful.

That works, I guess. We're close enough.msgid: That works, I guess.  We're close enough to getting on our own two feet that a little trade just might help.  Just give me directions.

On second thought, I might be back later.msgid: On second thought, I might be back later.

Gotcha, I'll have some of my men scout t.msgid: Gotcha, I'll have some of my men scout things out and work out a deal with them.  Should be able to direct some recent recruits their way to set things up.

What if there was another holdout in nee.msgid: What if there was another holdout in need of labor, that might have space to expand?

It's a different community actually. Sm.msgid: It's a different community actually.  Smaller, but fortified and starting to become self-sufficient.

Understandable. Know anyone else who mi.msgid: Understandable.  Know anyone else who might be able to make the trip?

I can't afford to gamble my life, and th.msgid: I can't afford to gamble my life, and the life of those I still have left, on a place I know nothing about.  I'm sorry.

Do you know if anyone else might be able.msgid: Do you know if anyone else might be able to help?

It's fine. I'd better get going..msgid: It's fine.  I'd better get going.

As bad as everything is, most of the peo.msgid: As bad as everything is, most of the people here would prefer it to risking the journey someplace else.  Every so often other people stop by, people who aren't afraid of what's out there.  I guess that might work?

If you get the chance, could you help sp.msgid: If you get the chance, could you help spread the word that another place is looking for people to work for them?

I'll see if I can figure something out..msgid: I'll see if I can figure something out.

I guess I can try. Gives me something t.msgid: I guess I can try.  Gives me something to do at least.  What sort of settlement are they supposed to be looking for?

A local group of monster hunters operati.msgid: A local group of monster hunters operating out of a roadside parish church, that they've started fortifying and building additional buildings near.

On second thought, I might be able to wo.msgid: On second thought, I might be able to work something else out.

Alright. I hope this works out for you..msgid: Alright.  I hope this works out for you.  I'm guessing you should talk to some of the others here, if you can't talk the others into going there, they might at least be able to help get the word out of another community out there.

I've asked a couple others already, hope.msgid: I've asked a couple others already, hopefully that should help.  I should probably check on the outpost.

Thank you. I'll keep at it for now..msgid: Thank you.  I'll keep at it for now.

Thank you. I'll keep asking around to s.msgid: Thank you.  I'll keep asking around to see where this goes.

Do you think they'd be willing to help o.msgid: Do you think they'd be willing to help out with another settlement, if that's what they need?

Can't hurt none to ask, I reckon. Cours.msgid: Can't hurt none to ask, I reckon.  Course, way it is out there ain't much better.  Folks stop by every now an' then, drifters who can take of themselves.

Think you could help direct visitors the.msgid: Think you could help direct visitors there?

I'll see if I can ask someone else..msgid: I'll see if I can ask someone else.

I might could help you with that. What'.msgid: I might could help you with that.  What's it like?  Can't tell them to hit the trail if I don't know where they're going.

Sounds like a boom town in the making, p.msgid: Sounds like a boom town in the making, pardner.  I'll see what gossip I can pass down the trail.  Take care now, y'hear?

You too. I should probably check on the.msgid: You too.  I should probably check on the outpost, talked to a couple others earlier.

You too. I'll keep at it for now..msgid: You too.  I'll keep at it for now.

You too. I'll ask around a bit more, ge.msgid: You too.  I'll ask around a bit more, get a couple more people helping with that.

There are other settlements out there, I.msgid: There are other settlements out there, I was asked to help find people to work at and trade with one.

Do you know of anyone who might be able.msgid: Do you know of anyone who might be able to help with that?

Would you be able to help keep an eye ou.msgid: Would you be able to help keep an eye out for someone who might be interested?

Could you help keep an eye out for any o.msgid: Could you help keep an eye out for any other visitors who might be looking for work?

I'll see what I can find out, thanks..msgid: I'll see what I can find out, thanks.

Guess I can try. Do you know where they.msgid: Guess I can try.  Do you know where they are, and anything else about them?

They're based in an old church along the.msgid: They're based in an old church along the roadside not too many miles away, that they've built up into a local outpost.

On second thought, I'll figure something.msgid: On second thought, I'll figure something else out.  Thank you though.

Okay, I'll keep an eye out as best as I.msgid: Okay, I'll keep an eye out as best as I can.  Here's hoping a little more trade in the area keeps us from starving.

I've asked a couple others already, I sh.msgid: I've asked a couple others already, I should probably go check on them.  See you later.

I'll ask around a bit more while I'm at.msgid: I'll ask around a bit more while I'm at it.  See you later.

I'll ask around some more as well. See.msgid: I'll ask around some more as well.  See you later.

Could work if I can spare the manpower,.msgid: Could work if I can spare the manpower, more variety should help keep the supply lines in good order.  Just give me directions.
